He was the director of a military hospital in Damascus.{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2012/02/11/gunmen-assassinate-army-general-in-damascus/|title=Gunmen Assassinate Army General in Damascus |agency=Associated Press |date= 2010-02-11|accessdate=2012-09-29|work=Fox News}} The Revolution Leadership Council, an anti-Assad group in Damascus, alleged that the government had carried out the killing itself.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/02/2012211131327549801.html |title=Violence rages in multiple Syrian cities |publisher=Aljazeera.com |date=2012-02-11 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} Meanwhile, fighting was reported in the suburb of Douma, while a video was posted online reportedly showing a tank firing its guns in the streets of Douma.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/syria-feb-11-2012-1746 |title=Syria – Feb 11, 2012 – 17:46 – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-02-11 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} More fighting in Douma was reported when soldiers stormed the Grand Mosque and detained a number of people who were inside. In the al-Qaboun clashes the day before, it was said that an activist in the area was shot dead by government forces.{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/story/2012-02-11/syria-violence/53046722/1 |title=Gunmen assassinate Syrian army general in Damascus – |publisher=Usatoday.com |date= 2012-02-11|accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 12 February 2012, a video was posted on the internet reportedly showing a Syrian military anti-aircraft vehicle being used in the streets of Douma with pictures of Bashar al-Assad pasted on the front next to the guns, and the vehicle appears to be firing directly at buildings.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/syria-feb-12-2012-0903 |title=Syria – Feb 12, 2012 – 09:03 – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-02-12 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 14 February, Syrian press agency told that the security forces discovered an insurgent hiding place and confiscated weapons, bomb making kits and military suits.{{cite web|work=Syrian Arab News Agency |url=http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/02/14/400455.htm |title=Terrorists Detonate Houses, Attack University Housing in Homs |date=2012-02-14 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120218132110/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/02/14/400455.htm |archivedate=18 February 2012 }} Also, an activist group reported the death of 3 insurgents.{{cite web |url=http://www.lccsyria.org/6404 |title=40 Martyrs 14-2-2012 | Local coordination committees of Syria |publisher=Lccsyria.org |date=2012-02-14 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120806214422/http://www.lccsyria.org/6404 |archivedate=6 August 2012 |df=dmy-all }} On 15 February, elite Syrian troops launched a large operation in the Barzeh suburb to locate insurgents hiding place, with around 1,000 troops deployed.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-202_162-57378080/syria-troops-storm-areas-of-hama-damascus/ |title=Syria troops hit Hama; Homs oil line attacked |publisher=CBS News |date=2012-02-15 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 15 February 2012, with clashes ongoing, FSA were seen on the streets of Damascus.{{cite web|title=Assad's forces storm central district of Damascus|url=http://www.emirates247.com/news/region/assad-s-forces-storm-central-district-of-damascus-2012-02-15-1.443282|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=28 September 2012}} On 18 February 2012, a military hideout was discovered in Douma as reported by state media, with the security forces finding 6 Kalashnikov assault rifles, 3 sniper rifles, 2 RPGs, 2 Turkish guns, a Turkish shotgun.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/21/2012/02/28/403170.htm |accessdate=28 February 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229225910/http://www.sana.sy/eng/21/2012/02/28/403170.htm |archivedate=29 February 2012 }} On the same day at least two protesters were reportedly killed in a bigger protest and funeral march for 3 protesters slain in the recent days before. In the central district of Mezzeh, near the Syrian Presidential Palace, the anti-government demonstration reportedly attracted tens of thousands of pro-democary protesters. Security forces then confronted them with gunfire and tear gas,{{cite web|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/46438489/ns/world_news-mideast_n_africa/t/syrian-forces-fire-mourners-near-assads-palace/ |title=Syrian forces fire on mourners near Assad's palace|publisher=MSNBC |date=2012-02-18 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} which was said to have killed and injured protesters.{{cite news|last=Sterling|first=Joe|title=In Damascus, street protests and diplomacy|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/02/18/world/meast/syria-unrest/?hpt=wo_c1|publisher=CNN|accessdate=28 September 2012|date=19 February 2012}} The number of dead was risen to 3,{{cite news|title=Syria: Bashar al-Assad's 'ghost gangs' that haunt Damascus|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/9091933/Syria-Bashar-al-Assads-ghost-gangs-that-haunt-Damascus.html|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=28 September 2012|location=London|date=19 February 2012}} The number of protesters was estimated up to 30,000.[https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/china-calls-for-peace-as-protests-grow-in-syrias-capital/article2343153/ China calls for peace as protests grow in Syria's capital] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120220011220/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/china-calls-for-peace-as-protests-grow-in-syrias-capital/article2343153/ |date=20 February 2012 }} On 19 February 2012, the area was calm, even though the opposition called for an even bigger "day of defiance" following the protests a day before. As no one turned up, the opposition then claimed that protests could not go on due to security forces being deployed in some districts of central Damascus. The streets of Mezzeh became largely empty, and people groups on the street were controlled on sight with some arrests. Students protests at local schools did occur however.{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/sns-rt-us-syria-shootingtre81h0ad-20120218,0,2512244.story |title=Topic Galleries |publisher=chicagotribune.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226072320/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/sns-rt-us-syria-shootingtre81h0ad-20120218,0,2512244.story |archivedate=26 February 2012 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.arabtimesonline.com/NewsDetails/tabid/96/smid/414/ArticleID/179861/reftab/36/t/Damascus-clampdown-after-defiance-call/Default.aspx |title=Damascus clampdown after defiance call |publisher=Arabtimesonline.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120220095224/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/NewsDetails/tabid/96/smid/414/ArticleID/179861/reftab/36/t/Damascus-clampdown-after-defiance-call/Default.aspx |archivedate=20 February 2012 }} === March 2012 === On 3 March 2012, the head of the [[Free Syrian Army]], [[Riad al-Asaad]], told [[al-Jazeera]] that FSA members had taken control of arms depots in Reef Damascus. He also stated that "the FSA killed more than 100 army troops in Reef Damascus." However, this was not confirmed by any media or the opposition groups responsible for tracking fatalities in the conflict as the sheer number would be counter-productive.{{cite web|url=http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/32147-17-killed-in-syria-violence-as-syrian-free-army-kill-100-soldiers-in-reef-damascus |title=177 Killed in Syria Clashes |publisher=Naharnet.com |date=2012-03-03 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} Riad al-Asaad's statement was made after a claim by another FSA leader that 100 soldiers were killed or wounded when the FSA seized a control of the bases. This FSA leader had said the report was preliminary, before it was confirmed by the commander of the FSA.{{cite news|author=Khaled Yacoub Oweis and Mohammed Abbas |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/syrians-still-waiting-for-food-fuel-as-troops-block-aid-in-homs/article2357812/print/ |title=Syrians still waiting for food, fuel as troops block aid in Homs |publisher=Theglobeandmail.com |date=2012-03-03 |accessdate=2012-09-29 |location=Toronto}} Two rebels and seven people harbouring them were killed by the Syrian Army in Duma, an activist stated for the news agencies.{{cite news|last=Holmes |first=Oliver |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/03/04/us-syria-idUSTRE8220CI20120304 |title=Some aid reaches Syria's Homs, refugees flee to border |publisher=Reuters |date=2012-03-04 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 10 March, two soldiers and three rebels were killed in a clash in the town of Daryaa, the London activist group reported.{{cite web|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2012/03/assad-promises-to-back-any-honest-peace-bid/ |title=Assad promises to back any ‘honest’ peace bid |publisher=Vanguardngr.com |date=2012-03-10 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 11 March 2012, London based S.O.H.R. reported that 19 soldiers were killed in Idlib and Damascus countryside,{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/news/world/story/2012-03-10/syria-assad-annan/53455066/1?csp=34news |title=Annan to hold second meeting with Syrian president |publisher=Usatoday.com |date= 2012-03-10|accessdate=2012-09-29}} 7 of them were reported dead in idlib, meaning the remaining 12 were killed outside Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/37c1b58a-6ac4-11e1-9781-00144feab49a.html |title=Assad rebuffs Annan as Syrian troops attack Idlib |publisher=Ft.com |date=2012-03-10 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} The following day, 3 rebels were killed in the areas. On 13 March 2012, SANA claimed a colonel was assassinated in the Damascus countryside. He was shot while heading to his military unit, causing his instant death.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/03/11/405252.htm |accessdate=13 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312155931/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/03/11/405252.htm |archivedate=12 March 2012 }} On 12 March 2012, major clashes were reported in central Damascus between the FSA and Loyalist army for the first time. Battles erupted in the Rukn Al-Din area in central Damascus. Gunshots were heard throughout the city, according to witnesses.{{cite web|title=Report: Clashes erupt between Syria troops, FSA in Damascus|url=http://www.jpost.com/Headlines/Article.aspx?id=261395|publisher=Jerusalem Post|accessdate=28 September 2012}} On 16 March 2012, Heavy fighting was reported in several Damascus suburbs, with the FSA fighting loyalist forces in those areas.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/syria-mar-16-2012-1144 |title=syria – Mar 16, 2012 – 11:44 – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-03-16 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} Three soldiers were reported killed.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/03/16/406327.htm |accessdate=17 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120604161818/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/03/16/406327.htm |archivedate=4 June 2012 }} This came before a [[car bombing]], the [[March 2012 Damascus bombings|third in Damascus]] which was claimed to have killed 27 people and wounded another 140. Among the dead were members of the security forces, as the bombs targeted an air force intelligence base and a criminal security centre.{{cite news|last=Burge |first=Paul |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/9151413/Syria-funerals-held-for-Damascus-bomb-victims.html |title=Video: Syria: funerals held for Damascus bomb victims |publisher=Telegraph |date=2012-03-18 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |location=London}} On 18 March 2012, heavy street fighting ensued in Damascus, with the main district of Mezze being the battleground between the FSA and the military. The district is home to many security installations and residents reported hearing heavy machine gun and rocket-propelled grenade fire through the night. State controlled media claimed two rebels and one member of the security forces were killed in the fighting. "These clashes were the most violent and the closest to the security force headquarters in Damascus since the outbreak of the Syrian revolution," said Rami Abdulrahman, who runs the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights. He said 18 government soldiers were wounded in the shooting.{{cite web|author=Abigail Fielding-Smith |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/08dd90f6-71cf-11e1-b853-00144feab49a.html#axzz1paDNoJjf |title=Street battle in Damascus suburb |publisher=Ft.com |date=2012-03-19 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} Details of the fighting emerged later. According to the Sunday Times, the fighting ended with a senior Sunni general, who had made it clear that he wished to defect to the FSA, and his family being escorted from their home under the protection of the rebels. The leader of this force said that 3 units of the FSA had launched an attack on Mezze at zero hour to secure the defecting general. Mezze is said to be home to Syria’s wealthy elite and is the capital’s most secure neighborhood, with embassies, armed guards and gated compounds. Two units of 10 men each where sent to secure the general, while a third larger unit assaulted Mezze Villas west, an area of Mezze where the house of [[Assef Shawkat]], the brother-in-law of President Bashar al-Assad and deputy head of the armed forces, is situated. Witnesses described heavy machine gunfire and RPG's being fired in the pre-dawn assault. A commander of the FSA said "We wanted to show the regime we are capable of launching operations in the middle of their home, just a few [miles] from the presidential palace. People think nothing is happening in Damascus, but it is boiling.". By the end, the army sent in armed helicopters to subdue the clashes, killing 7 opposition fighters, according to the FSA.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/03/25/203087.html |title=Free Syrian Army to conduct ‘Guerilla warfare’ in Damascus: report |publisher=English.alarabiya.net |date=2012-03-25 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} Also, 80 elements of the security forces including pro-government militia were reportedly killed and 200 wounded during the clashes. The deputy commander of the Free Syrian Army also said that two military tanks were destroyed during the operation.{{cite web|url=http://www.mjdna.com/Article.php?ID=2077 |title=سورية: مقتل أكثر من 80 عنصرا من قوات الأمن في اشتباكات بين الجيش الحر والنظامي |publisher=Mjdna.com |date=2012-03-19 |accessdate=2012-08-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.25jan-news.com/article.php?id=21366 |title=مقتل وإصابة 280 في اشتباكات بحي المزة – جريدة 25 يناير الالكترونية |publisher=25jan-news.com |date=2012-03-19 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728153333/http://www.25jan-news.com/article.php?id=21366 |archivedate=28 July 2013 }} On 20 March 2012, the Free Syria Army in Douma released an army general they had detained in return for several prisoners and the bodies of those killed recently by security forces.{{cite web|url=http://arabnews.com/middleeast/article589729.ece |accessdate=24 March 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120323211054/http://arabnews.com/middleeast/article589729.ece |archivedate=23 March 2012 }} On 21 March 2012, Assad's forces shelled the suburbs of Harasta and Irbin.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/03/20123215921238440.html |title=Syrian forces assault opposition strongholds |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=21 March 2012|accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 24 March 2012, after 8 protesters were wounded in a protest in Damascus, "very violent" clashes broke out in the Damascus area. Activists reported that explosions and small arms fire could be heard across a large part of Damascus province and in districts of the city itself, as anti-government protests were staged in Douma and Artuz close to the capital. The Observatory for human rights reported snipers and heavy armour in Douma.{{cite web|url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/world/fresh-clashes-break-out-in-damascus-1.1263144 |title=Fresh clashes break out in Damascus |publisher=Iol.co.za |date=2012-03-24 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} On 26 March 2012, three soldiers were killed as a military bus was attacked in Harasta.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/03/201232618744545826.html |title=Annan 'studying' Syria response to peace plan |publisher=Aljazeera.com |date= 2012-03-26|accessdate=2012-09-29}} On 27 March 2012, The chief of the Air force intelligence branch in Syria was reportedly killed, according to opposition forces in an attack in Damascus. The chief, Col [[Iyad Mando]] was considered to be the head of one of the most powerful bodies of the state.{{cite web|last=Issacharoff |first=Avi |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/syrian-air-force-intelligence-chief-killed-opposition-websites-report-1.420782 |title=Syrian Air Force intelligence chief killed, opposition websites report |publisher=Haaretz.com |date=2012-03-26 |accessdate=2012-09-29}}{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/235752#.T3dhhWHKtpE |title=Report: Syrian Air Force Intelligence Chief Killed |publisher=Israelnationalnews.com |date=2012-03-26 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} On 30 March 2012, the FSA captured an air force general in Damascus.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/30/world/middleeast/aleppo-syria-attackers-kill-two-officers.html |title=Syrian Rebels Kill At Least 2 Military Officials |publisher=NYTimes.com |date=2012-03-29 |accessdate=2012-09-29 |first=Anne |last=Barnard}} Also, in the suburbs of Harasta and Irbin opposition fighters were said to have fired RPG's at military buildings, killing at least one soldier.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/03/30/204234.html |title=Syria fighting rages as protesters march nationwide against Arab inaction |publisher=English.alarabiya.net |date=2012-03-30 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} ==Aftermath== === April 2012 === On 6 April 2012, the army invaded Douma and killed a civilian, serious fighting evolved after this in Douma.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/04/05/205560.html |title=At least 38 killed across Syria as fierce clashes rage on in rebel towns |publisher=Al Arabiya |date=2012-04-05 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} ==== Cease-Fire (from 14 April until 1 June 2012) ==== Sporadic incidents occurred in Damascus and in Rif Damascus Governorate during the cease-fire. Following the collapse of the cease-fire due to continued attacks by independent opposition Rebel groups, the area became the scene of the [[Summer 2012 Damascus clashes]]. On 18 April 2012, the government claimed that an army officer, a lieutenant colonel, had been shot dead in Douma.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/04/201241873011444737.html |title=Syria 'pledges respect' for Annan plan – Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2012-04-18 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 21 April 2012, an officer, a first lieutenant, was allegedly shot dead in the Damascus countryside.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/258/2012/04/21/413803.htm |accessdate=21 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130731144552/http://sana.sy/eng/258/2012/04/21/413803.htm |archivedate=31 July 2013 }} On 25 April 2012, 3 military officers were killed in Damascus, according to the opposition and government in the area.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/04/201242422832721994.html |title=Annan says Syria violence 'unacceptable'|publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=24 April 2012|accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 28 April 2012, after a suicide bombing rocked Damascus, State media claimed 11 security forces and civilians had died. SOHR reported that 2 of the deaths were civilians, meaning 9 security forces were killed.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/iran-apr-28-2012-0732 |title=Iran – Apr 28, 2012 – 07:32 – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-04-28 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 28 April 2012, the S.O.H.R. claimed that Syrian Army killed 10 rebels in the Damascus region.{{cite web |url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=390630&MID=149&PID=2 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120907050459/http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=390630&MID=149&PID=2 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2012-09-07 |title=Lebanon news – NOW Lebanon -Syrian troops kill 10 rebels in Damascus region |publisher=NOW Lebanon |date=2012-04-28 |accessdate=2012-08-08 }} These deaths were reported after a Syrian opposition group reported that hundreds of soldiers defected from the Syrian armed forces on Sunday in the outskirts of Damascus and Lattakia. This though could not be verified. On 29 April 2012, state media reported that 2 Syrian border guards of the army had been killed in fighting in the Damascus countryside.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/04/29/415455.htm |accessdate=30 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120604163402/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/04/29/415455.htm |archivedate=4 June 2012 }} On 30 April 2012, [[Brigadier General]] Shaker Tayjon was killed by a bomb blast in the Damascus countryside according to state media. Another officer, a lieutenant colonel was allegedly killed by a separate bomb.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/04/30/416040.htm |accessdate=30 April 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120503044106/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/04/30/416040.htm |archivedate=3 May 2012 }} Also, A director of a military hospital told Sky News that 10 to 15 dead soldiers were arriving every day and the same number were being treated for injuries sustained in the fighting. These figures only included incidents in the capital and southern Syria. In the hospital, a dead soldier who had been killed in Douma was brought in and a wounded army general who had lost his leg was shown.{{cite web|last=Marshall |first=Tim |url=http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16218605 |title=Bomb Blasts Hit Syria As UN Expands Mission |publisher=News.sky.com |date=2012-04-30 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615145307/http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16218605 |archivedate=15 June 2012 }} === May 2012 === On 2 May 2012, In Harasta, near Damascus, six members of the security forces were killed during clashes with armed opposition, according to S.O.H.R.{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20120502-syria-aleppo-ambush-cease-fire-un |title=Soldiers ambushed in Aleppo amid continuing clashes – SYRIA |publisher=FRANCE 24 |date=2012-05-02 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 3 May 2012, 7 soldiers and 1 rebel were killed.{{cite web |url=http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=392085#ixzz1tnM4msZj |title=Lebanon news – NOW Lebanon -Deadliest day for Syrian troops as monitors fan out |publisher=NOW Lebanon |date=2012-05-03 |accessdate=2012-08-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120508122859/http://www.nowlebanon.com/NewsArticleDetails.aspx?ID=392085#ixzz1tnM4msZj |archivedate=8 May 2012 |df=dmy-all }} On 9 May 2012, 7 members of a pro-government militia called the Shabiha were killed when their bus was destroyed with rocket-propelled grenades on the edge of Irbin, a Damascus suburb. An activist said that army tanks began to shell the suburb afterwards.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/syria-may-9-2012-1230 |title=Syria – May 9, 2012 – 12:30 – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-05-09 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} On 13 May 2012, an army colonel and other officers were reported killed.{{cite web |url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/05/13/418480.htm |archive-url=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20120608094903/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/05/13/418480.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=8 June 2012 |accessdate=13 May 2012 |df=dmy-all }} On 24 May 2012, a lieutenant colonel was shot and killed according to the Syrian government. 5 Police officers and 4 workers were also allegedly killed during the course of the day in a battle.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/05/24/421151.htm |accessdate=24 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120526001438/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/05/24/421151.htm |archivedate=26 May 2012 }} === June 2012 === ==== End of Cease-Fire on 1 June 2012) ==== On 1 June 2012, Following the ongoing killing of Army personnel, the Army restarted their cleansing operations, killing 5 people during raids in the town of Daraya outside the capital Damascus, the London-based SOHR reported. They stormed the town which is a center for the armed opposition with tanks and fired shells at its western districts, the SOHR said. Local activists said the five killed were civilians, adding that one of them was an activist and "regime forces burnt his body completely after they killed him."{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/06/01/217945.html |title=Germany, Russia agree on ‘political solution’ for Syria; Assad forces fire on protesters |publisher=Al Arabiya|date=2012-06-01 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 2 June 2012, 8 soldiers were killed on the outskirts of Damascus by the FSA.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/06/02/us-syria-crisis-clashes-idUSBRE85106T20120602 |title=Syrian rebels kill 14 soldiers in Deraa, Damascus |publisher=Reuters.com |date=2012-06-02 |accessdate=2012-07-15 |first=Oliver |last=Holmes}} On 9 June 2012, in Damascus, residents spoke about a night of shooting and explosions in the worst violence Syria's capital has seen since the uprising against President Bashar al Assad's government began 15 months ago.{{cite web|url=http://www.globalnews.ca/6442588297/story.html |title=Global News | Timeline: Uprising in Syria |publisher=Globalnews.ca |date=2012-10-04 |accessdate=2012-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120702063820/http://www.globalnews.ca/6442588297/story.html |archivedate=2 July 2012 }} The nearly 12 hours of fighting in Damascus suggested a new boldness among armed rebels, who previously kept a low profile in the capital. On 10 June 2012, three police officers were killed when a bomb exploded, destroying their vehicle.{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16244527 |title=William Hague: 'Syria Is Like 1990s Bosnia' |publisher=News.sky.com |date=2012-06-10 |accessdate=2012-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120616004938/http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16244527 |archivedate=16 June 2012 }} Also, around 600 Syrian Free Army fighters simultaneously attacked Government targets and Syrian army targets from five directions around the capital, in the biggest and most organised attack on Damascus at the time. One source reported that several Russians working with the Syrian Government were killed and others wounded.{{cite web|last=Marshall |first=Tim |url=http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16244610 |title=Syrian Fighters Co-Ordinate Attack |publisher=News.sky.com |date=2012-06-10 |accessdate=2012-07-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615195247/http://news.sky.com/home/world-news/article/16244610 |archivedate=15 June 2012 }} On early June rebels attacked [[Shabiha]] buses brought to quell protests in Qaboun, killing 20 Shabiha men and prompting forces from the nearby Airforce Intelligence compound to fire anti-aircraft guns and heavy mortar rounds into the district, according to opposition campaigners.{{citation needed|date=July 2012}} YouTube footage released by opposition activists also showed army trucks and soldiers in combat gear inside the [[Abbasid Football Stadium]] in the city, which has become a base for troops and Shabiha men confronting the opposition neighbourhoods of Jobar, Zamalka and Irbin just to the east.{{cite web |url=http://mar15.info/2012/06/damascus-dissent-brings-uprising-to-assads-gate/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140502124604/http://mar15.info/2012/06/damascus-dissent-brings-uprising-to-assads-gate/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2014-05-02 |title=Damascus dissent brings uprising to Assad’s gate |publisher=Mar15.info |date=2012-06-14 |accessdate=2012-07-15 }} On 16 June 2012, three opposition fighters were allegdly killed in Duma and a large number of others arrested when authorities raided their hideouts, SANA, state TV media, reported.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/16/425632.htm |accessdate=25 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121031025814/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/16/425632.htm |archivedate=31 October 2012 }} On 17 June 2012, the Syrian military once again attacked Damascus suburbs. Seven civilians, including three women, were killed in shelling of Douma, an opposition stronghold. Five civilian men were killed in Saqaba, the London-based SOHR said, adding some of them had been "slaughtered" with knives. SOHR called for independent investigation as "This kind of killing has become common in recent weeks." In the suburb of Irbin a man and his wife and child were hit by an artillery shell fired by the Syrian army.{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jYGJoFhKQ01kGdL5mHHd7GOhSgKQ?docId=CNG.43956ba2481f4609cdfe2e0c7ac4e00b.731 |title=Regime forces besiege Homs, 69 killed across Syria |publisher=Google.com |date=2012-06-17 |accessdate=2012-07-15 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} The Syrian government claimed they killed a man who had participated rigging car bombs in Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/17/425873.htm |accessdate=17 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120619182849/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/17/425873.htm |archivedate=19 June 2012 }} Widespread clashes were reported in Douma and Harasta with one general of the Syrian army and a police captain being killed by the FSA.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2012-06/21/c_131666724.htm |title=Clashes between government troops, armed men underway in Syria despite int'l calls for pacification – Xinhua | English.news.cn |publisher=News.xinhuanet.com |date=2012-06-21 |accessdate=2012-08-08}} The dead [[Lieutenant General]] [[Ghassan Khalil Abu al-Dhahab]] was shot and killed in Douma.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/21/426838.htm |accessdate=24 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120623033719/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/21/426838.htm |archivedate=23 June 2012 }} On 21 June 2012, according to the toll compiled by the London-based organization, 30 civilians were killed in the opposition bastion of Douma by the Syrian army.{{cite web|url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2012/06/22/222005.html |title=Death toll mounts as Russia confirms Syria-bound ship carried ‘repaired’ helicopters |publisher=Al Arabiya |date=2012-06-22 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 25 June 2012, 11 soldiers were captured by the FSA in Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/liveblog/topic/syria-153 |title=Syria Live Blog – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 26 June 2012, rebels reportedly blew up an artillery piece at the entrance to Qudsaya, Damascus suburb, with clashes taking place in both Qudsaya and al-Hama, about 8 kilometers from the center of Damascus. Army also stormed the neighbourhood of Barzeh amid fierce fighting. The SOHR group reported that the government had massacred residents in al-Hama, and at least 14 people were reported killed.{{cite web|url=http://www.naharnet.com/stories/en/44649 |title='Fierce Clashes' around Elite Unit Posts near Damascus |publisher=Naharnet.com |date=2012-06-26 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 27 June 2012, a pro-Government media station was attacked, killing seven people, four from the security services and three journalists while 13 rebels were killed near Douma according to the Syrian government.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/06/2012627132722216959.html |title=Deadly attack on pro-Assad TV channel|publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=27 June 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-15}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/27/428024.htm |accessdate=11 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120630131529/http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/27/428024.htm |archivedate=30 June 2012 }} On 29 June 2012 the latest development came as an activist reported a "massacre" in the Damascus suburb of Douma, about 15 km (9 miles) outside the capital Damascus. Heavy shelling was evident as the military tried to enter the suburb. 51 People were reportedly killed, including 10 who tried to flee the suburb but were stopped at a checkpoint by militiamen and executed.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/06/201262994612753522.html |title=Annan 'optimistic' about Syria talks|publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=29 June 2012 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} Resident of the city meanwhile said to press that city of Douma, on suburbs of Damascus, had become effectively ghost city, with most of its 200,000 population forced to flee as a result of rebel seizing with consequent army shelling. He also reported hearing for more than a week explosions from shelling in Harasta suburb, what resulted in collapse of ordinary life in Damascus. Security forces enforced unofficial curfew after 7 or 8pm when Shabiha militias arrest anyone wandering around the streets.{{cite web|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2012-06-29/damascus-resident-describes-the-collapse-of-ordinary-life/ |title=Damascus resident describes the 'collapse of ordinary life' |publisher=Itv.com |date=2012-06-29 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 29 June 2012, the Syrian Army continued its crackdown against the rebels in Douma, killing scores of rebels and arresting number of others. They claimed that 3 rebel deaths were confirmed.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/21/2012/06/29/428407.htm |accessdate=29 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120630122333/http://www.sana.sy/eng/21/2012/06/29/428407.htm |archivedate=30 June 2012 }} On 30 June 2012, it was reported that the military had regained control of Douma after a 10-day military offensive. Loyalists battled to control the ring of suburbs and settlements in the surrounding countryside. The army launches frequent offensives into the suburbs only to see them slip back into rebel control after they leave. Human rights groups said that conditions in Douma are miserable, with dead bodies in the streets. There is a lack of food, electricity and running water.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/topic/syria/syria-activists-regime-troops-recover-rebellious-damascus-suburb-douma |title=Syria activists: Regime troops recover rebellious Damascus suburb of Douma – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} The army was accused of damaging hospitals that treated the wounded in Douma and carrying out waves of mass arrests and also execution of Rebels. On 30 June 2012, in Douma, the Syrian army said that they seized 3 rebels weapons stores and a Rebel explosive factory used for terror attacks, where dozens of rebels were killed while many others were arrested.{{cite web|url=http://www.sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/30/428491.htm |accessdate=30 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121031030154/http://sana.sy/eng/337/2012/06/30/428491.htm |archivedate=31 October 2012 }} SANA reported that dozens of rebels were killed while many others were arrested.{{cite news|author=Bassem Mroue |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/syrian-troops-retake-rebellious-damascus-suburb-after-deadly-assault-activists-say/article4382797/ |title=Syrian troops retake rebellious Damascus suburb, activists say |publisher=The Globe and Mail |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2012-07-15 |location=Toronto }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Also residents reported that the army, after weeks of intensive shelling, finally managed to push its way into former rebel-controlled Douma City center and was sweeping streets in search of rebel fighters who according to other resident withdrew from city night before, after 10-day government offensive. Residents also reported decaying dead bodies lying on streets and arrest of hundreds of citizens{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/topic/syria/syrian-forces-invade-damascus-suburb-after-weeks-shelling |title=Al Jazeera Live Blog |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} to check on their implication with the rebels. Most where later released. An ITV reporter filmed a Syrian military funeral for the deaths of soldiers during the siege of Douma. 42 soldiers were killed in the siege of Douma, most of them in the last day and a half when the Syrian army entered Douma after having shelled the city for days.{{cite web|author=Bill Neely|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2012-07-02/is-syrian-army-losing-control-of-damascus/ |title=Is Syrian Army losing control of Damascus? |publisher=Itv.com |date=2012-07-02 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} Over 200 people were killed overall, with at least 25 women being raped by the Syrian Army in front of their families.[https://womenundersiegesyria.crowdmap.com/reports/view/111 Former Syrian army officer says 25 women raped in Douma]. Womenundersiegesyria.crowdmap.com (2012-08-06). Retrieved on 2012-10-08. One particular case that was documented by [[Women Under Siege]] was the case of a young woman whose apartment building was entered by the elite republican guard, and all residents taken out. They executed 8 male residents and brutallty raped the young woman.[https://womenundersiegesyria.crowdmap.com/reports/view/119 Man reports Republican Guards raped woman, killed men, in Douma apartment building]. Womenundersiegesyria.crowdmap.com. Retrieved on 2012-10-08. === July 2012 === On 1 July 2012, it was reported that 85 people had been killed by a car bomb in an attack on an anti-government demonstration, that started out as a funeral for a previous protester that had been killed by government soldiers. The car bomb had targeted the funeral march.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/topic/syria/zamalka-residents-gather-mourn-funeral-car-bomb-victims |title=Zamalka residents gather to mourn funeral car bomb victims – Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-07-01 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} Video footage appeared on the internet showing the explosions and aftermath.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/topic/syria/video-shows-mortar-fire-striking-funeral-procession |title=Video shows mortar fire striking funeral procession |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date=2012-06-30 |accessdate=2012-07-15}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m5KgMRyc_pg |title=Video shows the aftermath of the massacre |publisher=Youtube.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-15}} An initial false report by the UK based SOHR said that it was the government that killed at least 30 civilian protesters in this attack. On 2 July 2012, ITV News correspondent managed to get to the Irbeen suburb of Damascus with help of FSA fighters and confirmed that this and several other suburbs, including Zamalka, are completely out of government control with local rebel fighters patrolling on the streets openly. It was also falsedly reported that fighting in Douma was still ongoing.{{cite web|url=http://www.itv.com/news/2012-07-02/syria-crisis-deepens-in-damascus-as-funeral-explosion-kills-dozens/ |title=Syria crisis deepens in Damascus |publisher=Itv.com |date=2012-07-02 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 10 July 2012, 2 soldiers were killed when their military supply vehicle was destroyed in southern Damascus.{{cite web|url=http://supportkurds.org/news/monday-9-july-2012/ |title=Monday 9 July 2012 : Support Kurds in Syria |publisher=Supportkurds.org |date=2012-07-10 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 11 July 2012, there was heavy fighting in the Damascus neighbourhood of Zabdin, were members of the FSA attacked a missile base, prompting the defection of at least 27 soldiers there. Clashes, raids and shelling also continued in Irbeen, Douma, Zamalka and Kafarsoussah.{{cite web|url=http://us2.campaign-archive2.com/?u=556aeef60722f6e5811ea2519&id=76935e7dab&e=e2754ad10d |title=Syrian Daily Round-up – 11 July |publisher=Us2.campaign-archive2.com |date=2012-07-11 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 12 July 2012, Syrian army for the first time shelled areas of Damascus. Artillery fired several shells towards orchards in Kfar Souseh district where FSA was reportedly hiding. There was also clashes in New Artouz suburb, some 15 km from Damascus.{{cite news|agency=Reuters |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/syrian-forces-shell-outskirts-of-damascus-activists-say-1.450677 |title=Syrian forces shell outskirts of Damascus, activists say |publisher=Haaretz.com |date=2008-04-02 |accessdate=2012-07-15}} On 14 July 2012, reportedly a major escalation in Damascus took place from 14–15 July, when a coordinated attack by multiple rebel forces was engaged upon Damascus neighbourhoods. On 15 July 2012, [[Battle of Damascus (2012)|fierce fighting]] was reported in some quarters of central Damascus as the army moved in to dislodge rebels. The rebels fighting were the ones who were crushed in Douma and other suburbs and fled to Damascus itself. Fighting also closed the road leading from central Damascus to airport.{{cite news|last=Solomon |first=Erika |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/15/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120715 |title=Fiercest fighting yet reported inside Damascus |publisher=Reuters |date=2012-07-15 |accessdate=2012-08-28}}{{cite news|last=Siddique |first=Haroon |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/16/syria-fighting-damascus-live?CMP=twt_gu |title=live updates |publisher=Guardian |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29 |location=London}} On 16 July 2012, for a second day, heavy clashes in the southern Midan and Tadhamon districts of Damascus raged{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18859453 |title=Syria unrest: Second day of fierce Damascus clashes |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2012-07-16 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} with the military managing to surround the rebel forces in the area and sending tanks and other armored vehicles into the neighborhoods. The rebels called the clashes a raid by them against the capital,{{cite news|last=Karouny |first=Mariam |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/07/17/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE8610SH20120717 |title=Syria fighting closes in on capital |publisher=Reuters.com |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} while the government called it a 48-hour military operation to clear the area of any opposition forces. There were also indications that the government knew about the planned rebel raid and acted on the information.{{cite web|url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/721521.shtml |title=Syrian capital's clashes continue in southern part |publisher=Globaltimes.cn |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728161937/http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/721521.shtml |archivedate=28 July 2013 }} On 17 July 2012, shooting was reported in one of the main central streets and machine-gun fire was reported in nearby [[Sabaa Bahrat Square (Damascus)|Sabaa Bahrat Square]], site of the [[Central Bank of Syria]], which was the scene of several major [[Syrian civil war#Rallies in support of the Assad government|pro-government demonstrations]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18866265|title=Syria conflict: 'Fresh clashes rock Damascus'|publisher=BBC News|date=17 July 2012|accessdate=17 July 2012}} Fighting was ongoing in the southern Midan and Kfar Sousa districts and the northern Barzeh and Qaboun districts.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18866265 |title=Syria conflict: Central Damascus hit by clashes |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} There were contradictions among the rebels themselves on the nature of the conflict. One FSA commander claimed that the Battle for "liberation" of Damascus had begun,{{cite web|url=http://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/41304/iraq-calls-on-citizens-in-syria-to-return-home |title=FSA: 'Battle for liberation' of Damascus has begun |publisher=Lbcgroup.tv |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29}} with another dubbing it ''Operation Damascus Volcano''. But Tarek, the rebel spokesman in Damascus, dismissed the claims, stating the clashes were still only skirmishes. He also said the FSA didn't start the battle, which would be in line with earlier reports that the military made a preemptive strike on the opposition forces, after learning of their plan for the attack on the capital.{{cite news|last=Weaver |first=Matthew |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jul/17/syria-crisis-damascus-clashes-live#block-14 |title=1.44pm: Syria |publisher=Guardian |date=2012-07-17 |accessdate=2012-09-29 |location=London}} On 18 July 2012, a [[18 July 2012 Damascus bombing|bombing]] target the National security headquarters with Assad's most senior generals, known collectivley as the "crisis cell", were meeting. 4 were killed; Defense minister [[Dawoud Rajiha]], Deputy head of armed forces [[Assef Shawkat]], General [[Hasan Turkmani]] and National security chief [[Hisham Ikhtiyar]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-18920733 Syria attack: Security chief Ikhtiar dies from wounds]. Bbc.co.uk (2012-07-20). Retrieved on 2012-10-08. Fighting resumed with the [[Rif Dimashq offensive (August–October 2012)]]. == References == {{Reflist|30em|refs= }} == External links == * [https://www.hrw.org/reports/2011/12/15/all-means-necessary By All Means Necessary!], ''[[Human Rights Watch]]'', 16 December 2011 {{Syrian Civil War}} {{Rif Dimashq Governorate|state=collapsed}} {{Damascus}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rif Dimashq offensive, 2011 November 2012 March}} [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2011]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War in 2012]] [[Category:Damascus in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Rif Dimashq Governorate in the Syrian Civil War]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Syrian government]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the Free Syrian Army]] [[Category:Military operations of the Syrian Civil War involving the al-Nusra Front]] [[Category:November 2011 events]] [[Category:December 2011 events]] [[Category:January 2012 events]] [[Category:February 2012 events]] [[Category:March 2012 events]]

page.title: Scream It Like You Mean It

revision.text:
{{Infobox music festival | music_festival_name = Scream It Like You Mean It | image = Scream_It_Like_You_Mean_It_Tour_Logo_2012.jpg | caption = 2012 Tour Logo | location = [[United States]], [[Canada]], [[Europe]] | years_active = 2010–2013 | founders = Dave Shapiro, Matthew Stewart, Yogi Allgood | dates = | genre = [[Post-hardcore]], [[metalcore]], [[alternative rock]], [[pop punk]], [[electronic rock]], [[deathcore]], [[dubstep]] | website = {{URL|www.screamitlikeyoumeanit.com}} }}
'''Scream It Like You Mean It''' was a successful annual tour put on by founders and owners Dave Shapiro of [[Los_Angeles|Los-Angeles]]-based The Agency Group Ltd. and Matthew Stewart of [[Washington,_DC|Washington, D.C.]]-based [[Outerloop Management]]. Yogi Allgood was also a founder, owner, and creator of this tour from 2010-2013, but has since left [[Outerloop Management]]. Matthew Stewart also left [[Outerloop Management]] in January 2014. The national tour throughout 2010-2011 reached the United States and Europe; and 2012-2013 reached throughout the United States. According to co-owner, Matthew Stewart "the whole point of this tour and the reason we're doing this for the third straight year is because we try our hardest to make [the tour] a positive experience for both the fans and the artists on it."<ref>[http://www.lambgoat.com/] {{cite web|url=http://lambgoat.com/features/interviews/159/Scream-It-Like-You-Mean-It-interview/|title=Scream It Like You Mean It Tour 2012 Interview|publisher=http://www.lambgoat.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-25}}</ref> Matthew Stewart also mentioned that "in 2012 or 2013 we’d like to have the tour in the US, Europe, and Australia. We’d like to make it a world brand."<ref>[http://PropertyOfZack.com/] {{cite web|url=http://propertyofzack.com/post/7583689774/propertyofzack-interview-scream-it-like-you-mean-it/|title=Scream It Like You Mean It Tour 2012 Interview w/ PropertyOfZack|publisher=http://www.PropertyOfZack.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-25}}</ref>
== 2010 == The first tour featured eight main bands playing 26 shows, during July and August. Electric Zombie and MerchNow were sponsors.
=== Bands === *[[Silverstein (band)|Silverstein]] *[[Emery (band)|Emery]] *[[We Came as Romans]] *[[Dance Gavin Dance]] *[[I Set My Friends On Fire|I Set My Friends on Fire]] *[[Sky Eats Airplane]] *[[Ivoryline]] *[[Close to Home (band)|Close to Home]]<ref>[http://www.smnnews.com/] {{cite web|url=http://www.smnnews.com/2010/05/17/scream-it-like-you-mean-it-2010-tour-announced/|title=ScreamItLikeYouMeanIt 2010|publisher=http://www.smnnews.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref>
== 2011 Europe == The second tour featured four main bands playing 21 shows, during April and May. Avocado Booking and [[Outerloop Management]] were sponsors.
=== Bands === *[[We Came as Romans]] *[[Miss May I]] *[[The Word Alive]] *[[This or the Apocalypse (band)|This or the Apocalypse]]<ref>[http://www.smnnews.com/] {{cite web|url=http://www.smnnews.com/2010/12/16/scream-it-like-you-mean-it-european-tour-dates-and-bands/|title=ScreamItLikeYouMeanIt 2011 Europe|publisher=http://www.smnnews.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref>
== 2011 US == The third tour featured six bands playing 37 shows, during July and August. Music Skins and MerchNow sponsored the tour.
=== Bands === *[[Breathe Carolina]] *[[Chiodos]] *[[I See Stars]] *[[The Color Morale]] *ModSun *The Air I Breathe<ref>[http://punkmusic.about.com/] {{cite web|url=http://punkmusic.about.com/b/2011/07/07/tour-dates-the-scream-it-like-you-mean-it-2011-tour.htm/|title=ScreamItLikeYouMeanIt 2011 US|publisher=http://punkmusic.about.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref>
== 2012 == The fourth tour featured 18 bands, reaching 49 cities over five and a half weeks (July 5th through August 12th), and featured two stages; however, the tour was divided into two separate tours (entitled Blue or Red) which criss-crossed each other at multiple dates (entitled Gold). The Blue tour headliner was [[The Acacia Strain]], and the Red tour headliner was [[Attack Attack!]]. MerchNow and LA GEAR sponsored the tour.<ref>[http://www.lambgoat.com/] {{cite web|url=http://lambgoat.com/news/18179/Scream-It-Like-You-Mean-It-2012-lineup-takes-shape/|title=Scream It Like You Mean It Tour 2012|publisher=http://www.lambgoat.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-25}}</ref> Due to the closing of the venue Sonar in Baltimore, MD; the tour's last date became August 11, 2012 at Empire in Springfield, VA (Blue tour).
=== Bands === *[[Attack Attack!]] *[[We Came as Romans]] *[[The Acacia Strain]] *[[Woe, Is Me]] *[[Abandon All Ships]] *[[Oceano (band)|Oceano]] *[[Impending Doom (American band)|Impending Doom]] *[[The Chariot (band)|The Chariot]] *[[Texas in July]] *[[Like Moths To Flames]] *[[In Fear and Faith]] *[[For All Those Sleeping]] *[[Close to Home (band)|Close to Home]] *Volumes *[[Secrets (post-hardcore band)|Secrets]] *[[Hands Like Houses]] *[[Glass Cloud]] *At the Skylines<ref>[http://www.lambgoat.com/] {{cite web|url=http://lambgoat.com/news/18179/Scream-It-Like-You-Mean-It-2012-lineup-takes-shape/|title=Scream It Like You Mean It Tour 2012|publisher=http://www.lambgoat.com/|date= |accessdate=2012-05-22}}</ref>
== 2013 == The fifth tour featured seven bands, reaching 27 cities and dates during October and ending on November 5, 2013 in New York City. The lineup was heavily criticized for the smaller number of bands.
=== Bands === *[[Story of the Year]] *[[Like Moths to Flames]] *[[Hawthorne Heights]] *[[Capture the Crown]] *[[Set It Off (band)|Set It Off]] *Sienna Skies *I Am King *[[Silverstein_(band)|Silverstein]] (select dates)
[[Capture the Crown]] dropped off the tour in late October due to mechanical problems with their transportation.
Due to issues with attendance, a 2014 tour was not set up, and it is unclear whether the tour will be back again in 2015 and as of March 2016 nothing yet has been announced.<ref>http://substreammagazine.com/2014/09/scream-it-like-you-mean-it-not-happening-this-year/</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Recurring events established in 2010]] [[Category:American post-hardcore musical groups]] [[Category:Music festivals established in 2010]] [[Category:Heavy metal festivals]]

'''Shasta Regional Medical Center''', formerly known as '''Redding Medical Center''', is one of two major hospitals that are located in [[Redding, California]]. It opened in 1945 and currently has 246 beds with an acute care facility and has become a regional medical center serving far Northern California.<ref>[http://srmc.phcs.us/about-us.html Shasta Medical Center Website]</ref> It is also the first fully accredited chest pain center in northern California.
==History== It was purchased by [[Tenet Healthcare|Tenet Healthcare Corporation]] in 1976 and renamed Redding Medical Center. In 2002, amid a federal investigation of two cardiologists at the hospital, Drs. Chae Hyun Moon and Fidel Realyvasquez,<ref name="investigatin">[https://www.nytimes.com/2002/11/06/business/doctor-s-procedures-were-monitored-by-rival-hospital.html New York Times 11/6/2002]</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2005/11/16/business/16tenet.html?_r=1 New York Times 11/16/2005]</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2002/11/04/business/california-patients-talk-of-needless-heart-surgery.html New York Times 11/4/2002]</ref><ref name="washingtonpost">[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/07/24/AR2005072400969.html Washington Post 7/25/2005]</ref> and as part of a settlement with federal regulators, Tenet Healthcare Corporation was compelled to sell the hospital to Hospital Partners of America for $60 million USD in 2004.<ref>[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-115480370.html Tenet Healthcare Agrees to Sell Redding, Calif., Medical Center. ]</ref> Hospital Partners of America then renamed the hospital to its current name of Shasta Regional Medical Center and took measures to ensure that this incident would not occur in the future.<ref>[http://www.redding.com/news/2008/oct/30/prime-healthcare-services-one-states-largest-hospi/ Redding.com 10/30/2008]</ref>
Hospital Partners of America went into bankruptcy in 2008, and the hospital operations were taken over by [[Prime Healthcare Services]].
Shasta Regional is the only hospital in Shasta County certified as a Chest Pain Center and became a Primary Stroke Center for the region in 2006.{{citation needed|date=May 2012}} It was the first hospital in California and 11th in the nation to be certified as an Advanced Inpatient Diabetes Care hospital in 2010 by The Joint Commission.{{citation needed|date=May 2012}}
The hospital was named as a "Top Performer on Key Quality Measures" by The Joint Commission based on care and patient outcomes for Heart Attack, Heart Failure, Pneumonia and Surgical Care in 2010.<ref name="jointcommission">{{cite web|url=http://www.jointcommission.org/top_performers_on_key_quality_measures/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111001182433/http://www.jointcommission.org/top_performers_on_key_quality_measures/|archive-date=2011-10-01|dead-url=yes|title=The Joint Commission’s Top Performers on Key Quality Measures | Joint Commission|accessdate=2014-07-30|df=}}</ref>
==Legal issues==
===Unnecessary care and billing=== At Redding Medical Center, the early-2000s investigation, raid and litigation were prompted because "physicians undertook large volumes of inappropriate and unnecessary procedures on largely healthy patients".<ref name="GoWrong">{{cite journal| author=Walshe K, Shortell SM| title=When things go wrong: how health care organizations deal with major failures. | journal=[[Health Aff (Millwood)]] | year= 2004 | volume= 23 | issue= 3 | pages= 103–11 | pmid=15160808 | doi=10.1377/hlthaff.23.3.103}}</ref> The investigation into Moon and Realyvasquez was the result of multiple whistleblower lawsuits filed under the Federal [[False Claims Act]] alleging unnecessary medical procedures.<ref>[http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2003/07/17/60minutes/main563755.shtml CBS News 7/17/2003]</ref> Catholic Priest [[John Corapi]],<ref>[http://articles.sfgate.com/2002-11-10/news/17569435_1_redding-medical-center-invasive-heart-heart-surgery SFGate.com 11/10/2002]</ref> Joseph Zerga and Redding physician Patrick Campbell split 15% of the total $62.55 million settlement.<ref>{{cite news|author=[[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]]|date=November 15, 2005|title=Redding Cardiologists Agree to Pay Millions in Settlement|url=http://mathiasconsulting.com/cases/2005/11/CA/redding}}</ref>
Tenet had already agreed to pay $54 million in 2003 to settle the federal case without admitting any wrongdoing but with an agreement for new oversight procedures for physicians and staff.<ref>{{cite news|author=Kaiser Health Policy Report |date=August 7, 2003|title=Tenet to pay $54M to settle allegations that surgeons performed unnecessary procedures |url=http://www.kaisernetwork.org/daily_reports/rep_index.cfm?hint=3&DR_ID=19246}}</ref> In 2004, Tenet established a $395 million fund for 769 cardiac patients to settle civil suits relating to procedures performed by Moon and Realyvasquez.<ref>[http://www.gjel.com/verdicts/tenet1.html $117 Million: Victims of Unnecessary Heart Surgeries]</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Kaiser Health Policy Report|date=December 22, 2004 |title=Tenet Healthcare Agrees to $395 million settlement of lawsuit filed over alleged unnecessary heart surgeries |url=http://www.kaisernetwork.org/daily_reports/rep_index.cfm?hint=3&DR_ID=27373}}</ref>
There is also evidence that [[Prime Healthcare Services]] engages in upcoding elderly patients to [[malnutrition]]. At Shasta Regional Medical Center, Prime reported 16.1% of their [[Medicare (United States)|Medicare]] patients suffered from [[kwashiorkor]]. The state of [[California]] average for [[Medicare (United States)|Medicare]] patients is 0.2% suffering from kwashiorkor. Prime Healthcare Services is currently being investigated for [[Medicare fraud]] by [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]] and the [[California Department of Justice]].<ref name = "malnutrition">{{cite journal |last=Williams|first=Lance|author2=Christina Jewett |author3=Stephen K. Doig |title=Hospital chain, already under scrutiny, reports high malnutrition rates |journal=California Watch|date=February 19, 2011 |url=http://californiawatch.org/health-and-welfare/hospital-chain-already-under-scrutiny-reports-high-malnutrition-rates-8786}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|33em}}

[[Category:Hospital buildings completed in 1945]] [[Category:Hospitals established in 1945]] [[Category:Hospitals in California]] [[Category:Redding, California]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Shasta County, California]] [[Category:Prime Healthcare Services]] [[Category:Fraud]]

A '''sheep to shawl''' contest involves multiple teams that shear a sheep, spin the fleece into yarn, ply the yarn, and then weave it into a shawl.<ref>{{cite news |author=Jennifer Szweda Jordan |coauthors= |title=Extreme Crafts: Sheep To Shawl |url=https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=100185761 |quote=At a 'Sheep to Shawl' competition teams shear a sheep, spin the fleece and weave it into a shawl...all in just a couple hours. The fastest team wins. |work=[[National Public Radio]] |date=February 3, 2009 |accessdate=2010-05-03 }}</ref> The winning team is judged on a combination of time and quality and difficulty of the design.
The world record team for the similar international sheep to sweater competition has been the Netherlands team for many years (5 hours 1 minute in 2016).<ref>[http://www.wool.ca/B2B International Back to Back Wool Challenge]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Sheep wool]] [[Category:Competitions]]

In [[philosophy]], a '''state of affairs''' ({{lang-de|Sachverhalt}}), also known as a '''situation''', is a way the [[actual world]] must be in order to make some given ''proposition'' about the actual world true; in other words, a state of affairs (situation) is a ''truth-maker'', whereas a [[proposition]] is a ''truth-bearer''. Whereas states of affairs (situations) either ''obtain'' or ''fail-to-obtain'', propositions are either ''true'' or ''false''.<ref>[http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/states-of-affairs/ Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy Online]</ref>
[[David Malet Armstrong]] is well known for his defence of a '''factualism'''<!--boldface per WP:R#PLA-->, a position according to which the world is a world of facts and not a world of things.<ref>David Armstrong, ''A World of States of Affairs'', Cambridge University Press, 1997, p. 1.</ref>
==Overview== In a sense of "state of affairs" favored by [[Ernest Sosa]], states of affairs are situational [[Condition (philosophy)|conditions]]. In fact, in the ''Cambridge Dictionary of Philosophy'',<ref name=Sosa>[[Ernest Sosa]], 1999. "Condition". ''Cambridge Dictionary of Philosophy''. R.Audi, Ed. Cambridge: Cambridge UP. p. 171.</ref> Sosa defines a condition to be a state of affairs, "way things are" or situation—most commonly referred to by a [[nominalization]] of a [[sentence (linguistics)|sentence]]. The expression "Snow's being white", which refers to the condition snow's being white, is a nominalization of the sentence "Snow is white".<ref name=Sosa/> "The [[truth]] of the proposition that "snow is white" is a nominalization of the sentence "the proposition that snow is white is true". Snow's being white is a necessary and sufficient condition for the truth of the proposition that snow is white. Conditions in this sense may be called situational.
Usually, [[necessity and sufficiency]] relate conditions of the same kind. Being an animal is a necessary attributive condition for being a dog. Fido's being an animal is a necessary situational condition for Fido's being a dog.
==See also== {{wiktionary|state of affairs}} * [[Adolf Reinach]] * [[Carl Stumpf]] * ''[[Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus]]''
==Notes== <references/>
==References== * [http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=1158517991&sid=57&Fmt=2&clientId=18938&RQT=309&VName=PQD&cfc=1 A Historical Survey and Conceptual Account of States of Affairs, Matthew Roberts, Ph.D. dissertation]
[[Category:Philosophical logic]] [[Category:Ontology]] [[Category:Reality]] [[Category:Assumption]]<!-- do both parties obtain the the same state of affair, i.e., frame the problem identically? --> [[Category:Analysis]]
{{Ontology-stub}}

{{EngvarB|date=February 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{Infobox award | name = TVB Star Awards Malaysia | image = | current_awards = 2017 TVB Star Awards Malaysia | caption = | description = Excellence in television | presenter = [[TVB|TVB Entertainment News]], [[Astro Wah Lai Toi]], MY FM | country = [[Malaysia]] | year = 8 January 2005 | website = }} The '''TVB Star Awards Malaysia''' ({{zh|s=TVB 马来西亚星光荟萃颁奖典礼}}) is an annual awards ceremony honoring Cantonese programming achievements in [[Television in Malaysia|Malaysia]]. It is produced by [[TVB|TVB Entertainment News]], with [[Astro (television)|Astro]] and MY FM as media partners. The ceremony was previously known as the '''My AOD Favourites Awards''' ({{zh|s=MY AOD我的最爱颁奖典礼}}), which succeeded the '''Astro Wah Lai Toi Drama Awards''' ({{zh|s=Astro华丽台电视剧大奖}}). The Malaysian television channel [[Astro Wah Lai Toi]], presented by Astro, airs Hong Kong television programmes produced by [[TVB]]. In 2005, Astro organised its first awards ceremony, the [[2004 Astro Wah Lai Toi Drama Awards]], presenting awards to Hong Kong actors and actresses for their acting achievements in TVB television dramas. [[TVB|TVB Entertainment News]] took over the production of the awards series in 2013, renaming it The TVB Star Awards. It has since become an annual event, and is regarded as a prelude to Hong Kong's [[TVB Anniversary Awards]].{{cite web | url=http://img.b.tvb.com/wp-content/blogs.dir/tvbi/files/2014/02/20131201_tvb-star-awards-malaysia-2013_post.pdf |title=The Star-studded Malaysian TV Awards Presentation, TVB Star Awards Malaysia 2013”, Chilam Cheung and Linda Chung were crowned my favourite actor and actress | publisher=TVBI Company Limited |format=PDF |access-date=27 October 2015}} The [[2015 TVB Star Awards Malaysia|most recent awards show]] took place on 28 November 2015. The nominations for the TVB Star Awards are jointly determined by Astro and TVB for TVB programmes shown on [[Astro Wah Lai Toi]] throughout the designated year. Winners are decided by the Malaysian public. Presently, voting is done through a mobile app produced by TVB and Astro.{{cite news | work=Astro ZhongWen | url=http://zhongwen.astro.com.my/Channels/WLT/ArticleDetails.aspx?ArticleId=5866 | title=《TVB 马来西亚星光荟萃颁奖典礼 2015》 正式揭开序幕 |trans-title=The TVB Star Awards Malaysia 2015 has arrived | date=2015-10-13 | accessdate=2015-10-27 | language=Chinese}} ==Categories== ===Current categories=== {{details|TVB Star Award for Favourite Drama}} {{details|TVB Star Award for Favourite Leading Performance}} {{details|TVB Star Award for Favourite Supporting Performance}} {{details|TVB Star Award for Most Improved Performance}} Current award categories include: My Favourite TVB Drama Series,...Actor and ...Actress in a Leading Role, ...Actor and ...Actress in a Supporting Role, ...Drama Characters, ...On Screen Couple, and ...Drama Theme Song. These categories have been awarded since 2004. In 2011, My Favourite Most Improved TVB Actor and Actress categories were added. In 2013, My Favourite TVB Host In a Variety Program, ...Variety Program, and ...Enrichment Program awards were added bringing the total to thirteen My Favourite TVB awards. ===Discontinued or special categories=== Discontinued or special categories include: Most Unforgettable Slap in 2004. In 2005, categories included: My Favourite Gunshot, My Favourite Beauty, My Favourite Father-figure, and My Favourite Mother-figure. Most Unforgettable Kiss category was awarded in 2004 and 2008. My Favourite Supporting Character and My Favourite Extreme Appearance were awarded between 2006 and 2008 inclusive. Most Unforgettable Scene was awarded for the years 2004–2008. Most Unforgettable Villain was awarded in 2004, 2008 and 2009. My Favourite Legendary Character and My Favourite Outstanding Popularity King were awarded in 2012. Rising TVB Star in Malaysia was awarded in 2014 and Astro MY FM’s Special Pick for TVB Drama Theme Song was awarded in 2015. ===Honorary awards=== The TVB Star Achievement Award was first awarded in 2014. ==Years== {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="3" | Year ! rowspan="3" | [[TVB Star Award for Favourite Drama|Favourite Drama]] ! colspan="6" | Favourite Performance |- ! colspan="2"| [[TVB Star Award for Favourite Leading Performance|Leading]] ! colspan="2"| [[TVB Star Award for Favourite Supporting Performance|Supporting]] ! colspan="2"| [[TVB Star Award for Most Improved Performance|Most Improved]] |- ! {{Infobox television |show_name = The Hoober-Bloob Highway |image = The Hoober-Bloob Highway.jpg |caption = |genre = [[Animation]]
[[Comedy]] |writer = [[Dr. Seuss]] |voices = [[Bob Holt (actor)|Bob Holt]]
[[Hal Smith (actor)|Hal Smith]] |director = Alan Zaslove |producer = [[Friz Freleng]]
[[Dr. Seuss|Ted Geisel]] (characters) |executive_producer = [[David H. DePatie]] |company = [[The Cat in the Hat|Cat in the Hat Productions]]
[[DePatie–Freleng Enterprises]]
[[CBS Productions]] |network = [[CBS]] |first_aired = February 19, 1975 |last_aired = |runtime = 24 mins. |language = English |composer = [[Dean Elliott]] |country = {{USA}} }} '''''The Hoober-Bloob Highway''''' is an [[animation|animated]] [[Musical film|musical]] [[television special|special]] written by [[Dr. Seuss]] and produced by [[DePatie–Freleng Enterprises]]. The special first aired February 19, 1975 on [[CBS]], and was the last Dr. Seuss special produced for that network. Seuss also composed the song lyrics, which were set to music by [[Dean Elliott]]. Mr. Hoober-Bloob, a [[dispatcher]] of newborn children from some location in space, is preparing to send a new child down his [[highway]] to [[Earth]], but first, he gives the child a chance to decide for himself whether he wants the life of a human. Mr. Hoober-Bloob shows him the realistic problems and pleasures that people face in life. The story suggests that while things may be pretty bad, there's always something to be thankful for. ==Plot== The titular highway is a long and winding road that leads to [[Earth]] from an area high up in space where [[Pregnancy|newborn babies come from]]. The plot revolves around a newborn child, referred to as "Bub", as he tries to decide what he wants out of its life, or even if he wants to go at all, before being sent down the Hoober-Bloob Highway to be born. Mr. Hoober-Bloob, with the help of a [[lute]] with arms and legs that often breaks into fast-paced solos (which annoys Mr. Hoober-Bloob), explains to the child what to expect in human life. His explanations are often accompanied by musical [[sketch comedy|vignettes]] of the baby, depicted as a pre-adolescent boy, in an unusual situation that accompanies the song (such as being placed in front of a long and quickly scrolling tape with checkboxes on it and being expected to check the boxes quickly in the "Answer Yes or No" segment). Eventually, the baby makes the decision to depart for the world below, and Mr. Hoober-Bloob excitedly pushes his carriage down the Hoober-Bloob Highway at last. ==Cast== *[[Bob Holt (actor)|Bob Holt]] – Mr. Hoober-Bloob, Snail Race Announcer *[[Hal Smith (actor)|Hal Smith]] – Additional voices ==Credits== *Animation: Bob Richardson, Don Williams, Norm McCabe, Warren Batchelder, Nelson Shin, Bob Matz, Bob Bemiller, Brenda Banks, Bob Bransford, Ruth Kissane, John Freeman *Backgrounds: Richard H. Thomas, Gloria Wood *Layout: Dick Ung *Sequence Director: Gerry Chiniquy *In Charge Of Production: Lee Gunther *Camera: John Burton, Jr., Hogan-Lee Images *Film Editing: Rick Steward *Music by: Dean Elliott *Teleplay & Lyrics by: Dr. Seuss *Production Design by: Roy Morita *Storyboard by: Rosemary O'Connor, Chris Jenkyns *Directed by: Alan Zaslove *Executive Producer: David H. DePatie *Producer by: Ted Geisel and Friz Freleng ==Reception and presentation== ''The Hoober-Bloob Highway'' was nominated for a [[Primetime Emmy]], but it lost out to ''Yes, Virginia, There Is a Santa Claus''. It is one of the lesser-known Dr. Seuss animated specials,{{cn|date=September 2018}} having not been a book adaptation. It was given limited release on VHS, and can also be found alongside the VHS release of ''[[The Cat in the Hat (TV special)|The Cat in the Hat]]'' and the VHS and DVD releases of ''[[The Grinch Grinches the Cat in the Hat]]''. It is also included as a bonus special on the [[Blu-ray]] release of ''The Cat in the Hat''. It was also broadcast on [[ABC Family]]'s [[25 Days of Christmas]] on December 1, 2008. ==Soundtrack== ''The Hoober-Bloob Highway'' features a number of songs, centered on the decisions the newborn must make about his future life. All the lyrics are written by Dr. Seuss, all music by Dean Elliott. *The Hoober-Bloob Highway *...And That's the Way It Is, Bub *West Watch-A-Ka-Tella *This Is Your Life *Among the Daisies *That's Just the Beginning *Things You Have to Know *I Know the Way You Feel, Bub *On the Other Hand, Though *It's Fun to be a Human *What Do You Do? *Answer Yes or No *You're a Human The soundtrack was referenced by rapper [[Danny!]] through a track titled "This Is Your Life (In West Watch-A-Ka-Tella) (instrumental)" off of his album ''[[Where Is Danny?]]'' The Japanese version of this record, released via [[Interscope Records]], replaces the aforementioned track with another instrumental titled "...And That's the Way It Is, Bub", also in reference to the soundtrack. ==External links== * {{IMDb title|0248875}} {{Dr. Seuss}} {{DePatie-Freleng Enterprises}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hoober-Bloob Highway}} [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Television specials by DePatie–Freleng Enterprises]] [[Category:CBS television specials]] [[Category:Films featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Children's fantasy films]] [[Category:1975 television specials]] [[Category:Television programs written by Dr. Seuss]] [[Category:Television programs based on works by Dr. Seuss]] [[Category:Musical television specials]] [[Category:Animated television specials]] [[Category:Films scored by Dean Elliott]]
