{{redirect|La ruta del dinero K||La ruta del dinero K (book)}} {{Multiple issues| {{POV|date=August 2015}} {{Lead too short|date=January 2015}} {{Update|date=January 2015}} }} {{The Route of the K-Money}} '''The Route of the K-Money''' ({{lang-es|La ruta del dinero K}}; "K" stands for "''[[Kirchnerism]]''") was a 2013 political scandal in Argentina. It began with reports on the ''[[Periodismo para todos]]'' television program on the results of its investigation, led by journalist [[Jorge Lanata]]. [[Embezzlement]] and an associated [[money trail]] involved Argentine presidents [[Néstor Kirchner]], [[Cristina de Kirchner]] and their employee, businessman [[Lázaro Báez]].<!-- contractor? associate? verify --> The investigation concluded that Báez diverted money intended for public infrastructure to [[tax haven]]s. The scandal led to an official investigation.<ref name="Mercopress"> {{cite web |url= http://en.mercopress.com/2013/05/15/allegations-of-a-network-of-corruption-money-involves-former-president-kirchner |title= Allegations of a network of corruption money involves former president Kirchner |author= |date= March 15, 2013 |work= |publisher= Merco Press |accessdate=March 27, 2014 }}</ref> To date no judicial investigation ever found any proof of wrongdoing by Néstor Kirchner or Cristina de Kirchner. However, in April 2016 Lázaro Baez was awaiting trial on corruption charges in an Argentinian federal prison.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.infobae.com/2016/04/06/1802592-lazaro-baez-ya-esta-la-carcel-ezeiza |title= Lázaro Báez ya está en la cárcel de Ezeiza |trans-title=Lázaro Baes is already in prison in Ezeiza |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 6, 2016 |work= |publisher= Infobae |accessdate=April 7, 2016 }}</ref>
==Development==
===Television=== [[File:Lanata400.jpg|thumb|upright|left|alt=Smiling man dressed in blue, standing in front of books|Jorge Lanata in 1994; ''Periodismo para todos'' host]] ''Periodismo para todos'' began its 2013 season on April 14. [[Jorge Lanata]] reported that according to the tax return [[Néstor Kirchner]] sent to the AFIP, the Argentine revenue-collection agency,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.afip.gob.ar/english/|title=''Administracion Federal''|website=AFIP|accessdate=June 1, 2014}}</ref> he and wife [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] had personal wealth of US$1.4 million when he became president in 2003. She was elected president four years later; when Néstor Kirchner died in 2010, their assets were US$14.1 million. Lanata said that there was also a large amount of undeclared money.
The first program included interviews with [[Leonardo Fariña]] and [[Federico Elaskar]], who detailed methods used by Lázaro Báez to send €55 million to tax havens. Báez, a businessman from [[Santa Cruz Province, Argentina|Santa Cruz Province]], was a close friend of Néstor Kirchner. Fariña worked for Báez, and Elaskar headed SGI (a financial firm used for [[money laundering]]).<ref name="comercio"> {{cite web |url= http://elcomercio.pe/actualidad/1578484/noticia-kirchner-ruta-dinero-negro |title= Los K y la ruta del dinero negro|trans-title=The K and the black money trail |language= Spanish |author= Roger Zuzunaga |date= May 19, 2013 |work= |publisher= El Comercio |accessdate=October 22, 2013 }}</ref> Elaskar detailed operations at La Rosadita, a firm in the [[Madero Center]] building in [[Puerto Madero]]. La Rosadita channeled money from Santa Cruz to Uruguay and Uruguay to Switzerland, in €1.5-million increments via shell corporations.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573514-como-operaba-la-rosadita-la-financiera-de-puerto-madero-mencionada-por-leonardo-farina |title= Cómo operaba "La Rosadita", la financiera de Puerto Madero mencionada por Leonardo Fariña |trans-title=How did "La Rosadita", the firm in Puerto Madero mentioned by Leonardo Fariña, work |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 17, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 24, 2013}}</ref> Elaskar revealed more than 50 financial firms used for similar transactions; the operation required collaboration by banks as well.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575405-sgi-necesito-de-un-banco-o-un-cambista-grande-para-poder-sacar-los-euros-del-pais |title= SGI necesitó de un banco o un cambista grande para poder sacar los euros del país |trans-title=SGI needed a big bank to take the euros out of the country |language= Spanish |author= Florencia Donovan |date= April 23, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 30, 2013 }}</ref> Fabián Rossi, husband of actress [[Iliana Calabró]], was accused of managing financial operations in [[Panama]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1572765-lanata-mostro-la-ruta-del-dinero-de-lazaro-baez|title= Jorge Lanata mostró la ruta del dinero de Lázaro Báez|trans-title=Jorge Lanata revealed the trail of Lázaro Baez's money|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 15, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=October 22, 2013 }}</ref><ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/14-de-abril-periodismo-para-todos_060552 |title= 14 de abril - Periodismo Para Todos |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 14, 2013 |work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos |accessdate=March 28, 2014 }}</ref>
Fariña and Elaskar later recanted their statements. Fariña said on the TV program ''[[Intrusos en el espectáculo]]'' that he knew that he was being filmed, he lied to Lanata and he never carried bags of money.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573238-leonardo-farina-habla-tras-el-programa-de-jorge-lanata |title= Fariña, tras el programa de Lanata: "No fue una cámara oculta, sabía que me estaban grabando" |trans-title=Fariña, after the program of Lanata: "it was not a hidden cam, I knew I was being filmed" |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 16, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 11, 2013}}</ref><ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573468-farina-dijo-que-su-testimonio-habia-sido-todo-una-ficcion |title= Fariña dijo que su testimonio había sido "todo una ficción" |trans-title=Fariña said that his testimony has been "a complete fiction" |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 17, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 13, 2013 }}</ref> Elaskar said that he lied to harm Fariña.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573666-elaskar-aca-no-hubo-lavado-de-dinero-menti-pido-perdon|title= Elaskar: "Acá no hubo lavado de dinero, mentí, pido perdón"|trans-title=Elaskar: "There was no money laundering, I lied, I'm sorry"|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Gossip shows on state-sponsored TV channels called it the "Fariña-Rossi case", focusing on the impact on the television personalities, ignoring ties to Báez and Kirchner and downplaying the corruption charges.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573449-la-tv-de-chimentos-se-adueno-del-caso |title= La TV de chimentos se adueñó del caso |trans-title=The gossip TV took over the case |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 12, 2013 }}</ref> Rossi said that Fariña and Elaskar were deluded.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573066-fabian-rossi-no-tengo-nada-que-ocultar|title= Fabián Rossi: "No tengo nada que ocultar"|trans-title=Fabián Rossi: "I don't have anything to hide"|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 16, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 9, 2013}}</ref>
[[Eduardo Arnold]], vice-governor of Santa Cruz during Néstor Kirchner's presidency, said on the TV program ''[[La cornisa]]'' that in 2001 Cristina Kirchner showed him a [[bank vault|vault]] in her home in [[El Calafate]] for the family's savings; Arnold suspected that the vault, larger than a home safe, confirmed the alleged money laundering.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573663-arnold-cristina-me-dijo-que-iban-a-instalar-una-caja-fuerte |title= Arnold: "Néstor instaló una bóveda de banco en su casa de El Calafate, me la mostró Cristina" |trans-title=Arnold: "Néstor placed a bank vault at his home in Calafate, Cristina showed it to me"" |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 17, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 24, 2013 }}</ref>
In later programs, Lanata presented more evidence for the allegations. The second episode focused on the relationship between Báez and the Kirchners. Lanata documented agreements between Báez and Néstor Kirchner authorizing a builder, Austral Construcciones (owned by Báez), to build apartments on land owned by Kirchner. These documents had already been sent to the courts by deputy Elisa Carrió, who alleged illegal collaboration by Báez, Kirchner and minister [[Julio de Vido]].<ref name="lanjus"/> Lanata also detailed unusual growth in Báez's finances since the beginning of the Kirchner presidencies, and favoritism toward Austral Construcciones in the awarding of the majority of public contracts in the province.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575135-los-polemicos-negocios-de-la-constructora-austral |title= Los polémicos negocios de la constructora Austral |trans-title=The controversial business of the Austral builder |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 22, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 25, 2013 }}</ref> According to the Swiss bank [[Teegan]], a [[shell corporation]] wholly owned by Lázaro Báez's son Martín, transferred $1.5 million {{where|date=May 2016}}. Jorge Harguindeguy, former Argentine ambassador to Panama, confirmed the Panamanian operations of La Rosadita.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575118-jorge-lanata-mostro-documentos-que-certificarian-los-lazos-entre-nestor-kirchner-y-lazaro-ba |title= Jorge Lanata mostró documentos que certifican los lazos entre Néstor Kirchner y Lázaro Báez |trans-title=Jorge Lanata showed documents that prove the links between Néstor Kirchner and Lázaro Báez |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 22, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=December 25, 2013 }}</ref> Travel records obtained by ''[[La Nación]]'' indicate that Fariña, Rossi, Martín Báez and Daniel Pérez Gadín (Báez's accountant) all visited Panama, often at the same time. Fariña flew from Uruguay to Panama on the official plane of [[Chaco Province]], governed by Kirchner supporter [[Jorge Capitanich]].<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1577133-los-vuelos-a-panama-ahondan-las-sospechas-sobre-baez |title= Los vuelos a Panamá ahondan las sospechas sobre Báez |trans-title=The flights to Panama increase the suspicions over Baez |language= Spanish |author= Hugo Alconada Mon |date= April 28, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=January 1, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/21-de-abril-periodismo-para-todos_060670 |title= 21 de abril - Periodismo Para Todos |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 21, 2013 |work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos |accessdate=March 28, 2014 }}</ref>
On April 28, Lanata detailed links between minister [[Julio de Vido]], Kirchner and Báez. De Vido allegedly requested bribes for Báez. Estela Kank, former owner of Kank y Costilla, described collusion by De Vido and Báez to force her to sell her company to Báez.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1577275-lanata-volvio-a-mostrar-pruebas-que-vinculan-a-lazaro-baez-con-el-kirchnerismo |title= De Vido, acusado de cobrar coimas y ser "el cajero" del kirchnerismo |trans-title=De Vido, accused of bribes and of being the "cashier" of Kirchnerism |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 29, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=January 2, 2014 }}</ref> [[Sergio Acevedo]], former governor of Santa Cruz, said that Kirchner demanded an increase of over 300% in Báez's monthly public-works budget. Acevedo made similar accusations against the Kirchners in 2009, saying that public works in the province were always performed by firms associated with Báez.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1577191-acevedo-renovo-sus-denuncias-sobre-negocios-turbios-entre-baez-y-kirchner |title= Acevedo renovó sus denuncias sobre negocios turbios entre Báez y Kirchner |trans-title=Acevedo renewed his denounces about dirty business between Báez and Kirchner |language= Spanish |author= |date= April 28, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=January 2, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/28-de-abril-periodismo-para-todos_060807|title= 28 de abril - Periodismo Para Todos|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 28, 2013|work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos|accessdate=March 28, 2014}}</ref>
Lanata aired an interview with Miriam Quiroga, Néstor Kirchner's secretary,<ref name="comercio"/> who described people moving full bags of money from the [[Casa Rosada]] and the [[Quinta de Olivos]] to [[El Calafate]] (Kirchner's hometown) with the [[Tango 01]] presidential aircraft.<ref name="Mercopress" /> When later, in 2015, Quiroga was questioned by Judge Luis Rodríguez she confessed that these were false allegations intended to promote a book on the subject co-authored with her husband.<ref name= "Quiroga false allegations"> {{cite news |last= Kollmann |first= Raúl |date= 15 July 2015 |title= Los bolsos con dinero que no existieron |trans-title= The bags that didn't existed |url= http://www.pagina12.com.ar/diario/elpais/1-277112-2015-07-15.html |language= spanish |newspaper= Página 12 |location= Buenos Aires, Argentina |access-date= 17 February 2016 }}</ref>
In the 2014 Lanata's interview with Quiroga, she alleged Cristina Fernández de Kirchner was aware of the operations; although she could not confirm the existence of a vault at the Kirchners' house, what she overheard made her suspect that it was likely.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1579333-otra-denuncia-por-la-ruta-del-dinero-kirchnerista|title= Otra denuncia por la "ruta del dinero kirchnerista"|trans-title=Another denounce for the "kirchnerist money trail"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/5-de-mayo-periodismo-para-todos_060938|title= 5 de mayo - Periodismo Para Todos|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 5, 2013|work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos|accessdate=March 28, 2014}}</ref> Former prosecutor Andrés Vivanco said that Báez's wealth is actually Néstor Kirchner's. He described two other vaults in [[Río Gallegos]]: one belonging to Cristina Kirchner, the other to Báez.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1583276-ex-fiscal-de-santa-cruz-lo-que-tiene-lazaro-baez-es-de-nestor-kirchner|title= Ex fiscal de Santa Cruz: "Lo que tiene Lázaro Báez es de Néstor Kirchner"|trans-title=Former prosecutor from Santa Cruz: "Everything Lázaro Báez has belongs to Néstor Kirchner"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 18, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 22, 2013}}</ref> The May 12 program included an interview with Antonio Cañas, the Kirchners' architect, who described the existence and location of a safe in their house's architectural plan.<ref name="Mercopress" /><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1581408-jorge-lanata-mostro-los-planos-de-la-supuesta-boveda-de-los-kirchner|title= Jorge Lanata mostró los planos de la supuesta bóveda de los Kirchner|trans-title=Jorge Lanata showed the plans of the alleged Kirchner's vault|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/12-de-mayo-periodismo-para-todos_061097|title= 12 de mayo - Periodismo Para Todos|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 12, 2013|work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos|accessdate=March 28, 2014}}</ref>
On May 19, Lanata made further accusations of money laundering against Néstor Kirchner, his son Máximo, Lázaro Báez and sports agent [[Miguel Ángel Pires]] involving the acquisition of soccer players (including Rubén Ramírez, Pablo Lugüercio, Marcos Cáceres, Nicolás Cabrera, Leandro González and Martín Wagner) for [[Racing Club de Avellaneda]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1583608-jorge-lanata-denuncio-que-nestor-kirchner-y-lazaro-baez-compraron-jugadores-de-racing-para-l|title= Jorge Lanata denunció que Néstor Kirchner y Lázaro Báez compraron pases de jugadores para Racing|trans-title=Jorge Lanata denounced that Néstor Kirchner and Lázaro Báez bought players for Racing Club|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 20, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 22, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/periodismo-para-todos-19-de-mayo_061250|title= Periodismo Para Todos - 19 de mayo|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 19, 2013|work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos|accessdate=March 28, 2014}}</ref>
Elisa Carrió accused Báez of removing evidence from a vault at his house, and a witness who helped empty the vault had photos and bags. At a press conference at his house, Báez showed reporters a wine cellar at the location of the alleged vault.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/mundo/cruce-de-acusaciones-por-supuesta-boveda-de-empresario-kirchnerista.html |title= Cruce de acusaciones por supuesta bóveda de empresario kirchnerista |trans-title=Crossing of denounces over alleged vault of Kirchnerite businessman |language= Spanish |author= |date= May 22, 2013 |work= |publisher= El País |accessdate=March 30, 2014 }}</ref> Carrió replied that the photos showed both the wine cellar and the vault, and the wine cellar shown by Báez was next to a freshly-painted wall.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1584620-elisa-carrio-mostrando-su-casa-lazaro-se-incrimino |title= Elisa Carrió: "Mostrando su casa, Lázaro se incriminó" |trans-title=Elisa Carrió: "By showing his house, Lázaro incriminated himself" |language= Spanish |author= Jaime Rosemberg |date= May 23, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=January 4, 2014 }}</ref> Lanata aired the photos, explaining how Báez could have emptied the vault and prepared the area for invited journalists.<ref name="futbol"> {{cite web |url= http://internacional.elpais.com/internacional/2013/05/27/actualidad/1369680120_309509.html |title= El periodista crítico que venció al fútbol en Argentina |trans-title=The critic journalist that defeated football in Argentina |language= Spanish |author= Francisco Peregil |date= May 27, 2013 |work= |publisher= El País |accessdate=January 4, 2014 }}</ref>
A search and seizure took place at Madero Center several days after the first program. On June 16, Lanata aired security-camera tapes showing the removal of boxes, papers and file folders on April 12 at 14:20 (two days before the first program aired) and April 18 at 16:22 (hours before the search and seizure).<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1592826-revelan-como-se-saco-documentacion-de-la-rosadita |title= Revelan cómo se sacó documentación de "La Rosadita" |trans-title=It is revealed how did they remove money from "La Rosadita" |language= Spanish |author= |date= June 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 7, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/16-de-junio-periodismo-para-todos_061872 |title= 16 de junio - Periodismo Para Todos |language= Spanish |author= |date= June 16, 2013 |work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos |accessdate=March 28, 2014 }}</ref>
''[[La Nación]]'' exposed a business connection between President [[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] and Lázaro Báez: they co-owned an {{convert|87|ha|acre|adj=on|abbr=on}} plot of land outside [[El Calafate]]. She bought a half-share in 2006 and in turn sold it to Báez in 2008. Báez built a road<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1607166-la-presidenta-comparte-con-lazaro-baez-la-propiedad-de-un-terreno |title= La Presidenta comparte con Lázaro Báez la propiedad de un terreno|trans-title=The president shares with Báez the property of a terrain|language= Spanish|author= Mariela Arias' |date= August 3, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 12, 2014}}</ref> and a luxury hotel; he paid rent for one-third of the rooms (even if they were empty), channeling public money to the Kirchners.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.webpronews.com/cristina-fernandez-accused-of-funneling-taxpayer-money-2013-12 |title= Cristina Fernandez Accused of Funneling Taxpayer Money |author= Sarah Parrott|date= December 19, 2013 |work= |publisher= Web Pro News |accessdate=March 27, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.business-anti-corruption.com/country-profiles/the-americas/argentina/corruption-levels/public-procurement-and-contracting.aspx |title= Argentina - Public Procurement and Contracting |author= |date= |work= |publisher= Business Anti-Corruption portal |accessdate=March 27, 2014 }}</ref> Several politicians criticized the [[conflict of interest]]; deputies Patricia Bullrich and Laura Alonso asked the anticorruption office to investigate the situation, and Elisa Carrió and Mariana Zuvic asked to add this information to ongoing investigations.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1607373-denunciaran-ante-la-oa-el-vinculo-de-la-presidenta-con-lazaro-baez|title= Denunciarán ante la OA el vínculo de la Presidenta con Lázaro Báez|trans-title=The link of the president with Lázaro Báez will be denounced to the OA|language= Spanish |author= Mariela Arias |date= August 4, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 12, 2014}}</ref>
On August 18 Lanata said that according to official reports, Cristina Kirchner visited the [[Seychelles]] on January 21 and 22, although there was no record of presidential activities on those days. The islands were mentioned by Elaskar as a fiscal destination. Several months after her visit, Seychelles no longer met the criteria for [[tax haven]]s. Lanata also said that Néstor Kirchner created a [[Shell corporation|shell subsidiary]] of his [[Panama]]nian corporation in Ireland.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1611975-jorge-lanata-denuncio-la-existencia-de-un-paraiso-fiscal-vinculado-a-la-ruta-del-dinero-k|title= Jorge Lanata mostró las islas Seychelles, el paraíso fiscal vinculado a la ruta del dinero K|trans-title=Jorge Lanata showed the Seychelles islands, the fiscal paradise linked to the road of the money K |language= Spanish |author= |date= August 19, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=August 19, 2013 }}</ref><ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/18-de-agosto-periodismo-para-todos_063248 |title= 18 de agosto - Periodismo Para Todos |language= Spanish |author= |date= August 18, 2013 |work= |publisher= Periodismo para todos |accessdate=March 28, 2014 }}</ref> [[Oscar Parrilli]] said that Cristina Kirchner's stay in Seychelles was 13 hours rather than two days, and criticized Lanata for blindly accepting official information.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1612024-el-comunicado-de-casa-rosada-contra-jorge-lanata |title= El comunicado de Casa Rosada contra Jorge Lanata |trans-title=The manifest of Casa Rosada against Jorge Lanata |language= Spanish|author= |date= August 19, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 15, 2014 }}</ref> Parrilli called Lanata a hitman and [[Grupo Clarín]] a threat to democracy.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.clarin.com/politica/Gobierno-cuestionaron-publicado-Boletin-Oficial_0_977302578.html |title= Parrilli dice que Lanata es "un asesino mediático" |trans-title=Parrilli says that Lanata is "a media murderer" |language= Spanish |author= |date= August 19, 2013 |work= |publisher= Clarín |accessdate=October 22, 2013 }}</ref> In return, Lanata sued Parrilli for harassment.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1613640-jorge-lanata-denunciara-penalmente-a-oscar-parrilli-por-hostigamiento |title= Jorge Lanata denunciará penalmente a Oscar Parrilli por hostigamiento |trans-title=Jorge Lanata will denounce Oscar Parrilli for harassment |language= Spanish |author= |date= August 24, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 13, 2014 }}</ref> Lanata aired an interview with Venezuelan journalist [[Nella De Luca]], who was at Kirchner's hotel and confirmed her presence.<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1614027-jorge-lanata-presento-a-una-supuesta-testigo-de-la-estadia-de-cristina-kirchner-en-las-islas |title= Jorge Lanata presentó a una supuesta testigo de la estadía de Cristina Kirchner en las islas Seychelles |trans-title=Jorge Lanata showed an alleged witness of the stay of Cristina Kirchner at the Seychelles |language= Spanish|author= |date= August 26, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=February 15, 2014 }}</ref> Horacio Quiroga, a former businessman associated with Báez, described links from Báez and Néstor Kirchner to Lanata and the magazine ''[[Noticias (magazine)|Noticias]]''. Quiroga and Báez worked for the oil firms Epsur and Mishar, and were visited by an agent for Kirchner;<ref> {{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1618206-un-ex-socio-de-lazaro-baez-revelo-vinculos-entre-el-empresario-y-nestor-kirchner |title= Un ex socio de Lázaro Báez reveló vínculos entre el empresario y Néstor Kirchner |trans-title=A former associate of Lázaro Báez revealed links between the businessman and Néstor Kirchner |language= Spanish |author= |date= September 9, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=March 26, 2014 }}</ref> his testimony was included in the court case.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1619697-horacio-quiroga-las-indicaciones-y-ordenes-las-recibia-baez-de-nestor-kirchner |title= Horacio Quiroga: "Las indicaciones y órdenes las recibía Báez de Néstor Kirchner" |trans-title=Horacio Quiroga: "Báez received the commands and orders from Néstor Kirchner" |language= Spanish|author= |date= September 13, 2013 |work= |publisher= La Nación |accessdate=March 26, 2014 }}</ref>
===Judiciary=== [[File:Elisa Carrió - Diputados.jpg|thumb|alt=Smiling, blonde woman with multicolored scarf|Deputy Elisa Carrió filed a court case.]] Several politicians petitioned the courts after the first program was aired. Deputy [[Elisa Carrió]] filed a case with judge [[Julián Ercolini]], who was already investigating Lázaro Báez for conspiracy. Ercolini gave Carrió's case to a Kirchner supporter, judge [[Sebastián Casanello]]. Prosecutor Guillermo Marijuan began an investigation; attorney Alejandro Sánchez Kalbermatten filed a similar case against Lázaro Báez, his sons Martín Báez and Leandro Báez, Daniel Pérez Gadín and Fabián Rossi after Carrio's, but before her case was given to Casanello. The prosecutor was Miguel Ángel Osorio. Attorney Ricardo Monner Sans and deputies [[Manuel Garrido]] and [[Graciela Ocaña]] filed additional cases. Since the cases were similar, President of the Federal Chamber [[Martín Irurzun]] had to decide which judge would preside.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573164-la-oposicion-presento-cinco-denuncias-por-el-escandalo-de-lazaro-baez|title= La oposición presentó cinco denuncias por el escándalo de Lázaro Báez|trans-title=The opposition presented five denouncements for the Lázaro Báez scandal|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 16, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 9, 2013}}</ref> Canicoba Corral rejected the case and sent it to Casanello, who sent it to the Federal Chamber;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573576-el-juez-casanello-remitio-las-denuncias-sobre-presunto-lavado-de-dinero-a-la-camara-federal|title= El juez Casanello remitió las denuncias sobre presunto lavado de dinero a la Cámara Federal|trans-title=Judge Casanello sent the denounces about alleged money laundering to the Federal Chamber|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 24, 2013}}</ref> Casanello was finally confirmed as judge.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573584-casanello-sera-el-juez-que-investigara-el-presunto-lavado-de-dinero-de-baez|title= El juez Casanello investigará a Báez por "asociación ilícita y encubrimiento"|trans-title=Judge Casanello will investigate Báez for "illicit association and concealment"|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 24, 2013}}</ref>
Canicoba Corral roled that although a hidden camera may be acceptable as proof in [[investigative journalism]], it is inadmissible in court, adding that he had not analyzed the case and had no opinion. Argentine [[case law]] does not accept hidden cameras as proof of crime, since they constitute [[self-incrimination]]. However, they are admissible when witnesses have conflicting testimony; an unedited film may clarify which witness is more accurate.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573450-canicoba-resto-valor-a-las-camaras-ocultas|title= Canicoba restó valor a las cámaras ocultas|trans-title=Canicoba dismissed the value of the hidden cameras|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 11, 2013}}</ref>
Prosecutors Ramiro González and Carlos Gonella asked Casanello for an investigation of Fariña and Elaskar when he was confirmed as judge. Their initial request did not mention Lázaro Báez or the Kirchners, but was open to expansion. The prosecutors requested unedited copies of both films aired by ''Periodismo para todos'' and the later TV programs, where Fariña and Elaskar said that they had lied.<ref name="farelaros"/> Jorge Lanata gave his testimony to the prosecutor [[José María Campagnoli]] on April 22.<ref name="lanjus">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575139-jorge-lanata-declaro-ante-la-justicia-por-las-denuncias-de-lavado-de-dinero-de-su-programa|title= Jorge Lanata declaró ante la Justicia por las denuncias de lavado de dinero de su programa|trans-title=Jorge Lanata gave testimony to the judiciary for the denounces in his program|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 22, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Senator [[Mario Cimadevilla]] of the [[Radical Civic Union]] criticized Gils Carbó for the appointment of prosecutors, including Gonella, without Senate approval.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575691-denunciaron-a-gils-carbo-por-designar-fiscales-ilegalmente|title= Denunciaron a Gils Carbó por designar fiscales ilegalmente|trans-title=Gils Carbó was denounced for appointing prosecutors illegally|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= April 24, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 30, 2013}}</ref> Carbó streamlined the appointment system,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1576024-tras-la-denuncia-cambian-los-concursos-de-fiscales|title= Tras la denuncia, cambian los concursos de fiscales|trans-title=After the denouncement, the system for appointing prosecutors is changed|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 25, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 30, 2013}}</ref> and the charges against him were dropped ten days later.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1579571-la-justicia-cerro-la-causa-contra-gils-carbo-por-las-designaciones-ilegales-de-fiscales|title= La Justicia cerró la causa contra Gils Carbó por las designaciones ilegales de fiscales|trans-title=The judiciary closed the case against Gils Carbó for the appointment of prosecutors|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= May 7, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Guillermo Marijuan appealed this, saying that he had received death threats against his daughters and was receiving protection.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1580197-a-pesar-de-las-amenazas-marijuan-apelo-contra-su-jefa-gils-carbo|title= A pesar de las amenazas, Marijuan apeló contra su jefa, Gils Carbó|trans-title=Despite the threats, Marijuan appealed against his chief, Gils Carbó|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= May 9, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Campagnoli mentioned that the AFIP, IGJ and Migrations{{clarify|date=June 2014}} refused to give him information.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1585311-el-fiscal-denuncio-que-la-afip-la-igj-y-migraciones-le-negaron-informacion|title= El fiscal denunció que la AFIP, la IGJ y Migraciones le negaron información|trans-title=The prosecutor denounced that the AFIP, IGJ and Migrations refused information|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= May 25, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref>
Fariña and Elaskar presented their testimony on June 10. Elaskar said that Lanata had scripted what he said on television, and denied any personal relationship with Báez. He also denied being coerced to sell his company (which he had said on TV) and said that the shell-corporation documents were forged by Lanata.<ref name="dosdec">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1590825-caso-baez-farina-y-elaskar-acusaron-a-lanata-ante-el-juez|title= Caso Báez: Fariña y Elaskar acusaron a Lanata ante el juez|trans-title=Báez case: Fariña and Elaskar accused Lanata before the judge|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= June 11, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 14, 2014}}</ref> Elaskar refused to reveal whether or not he had assets abroad, and said that he did not remember details about the sale of his firm.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1591418-elaskar-no-quiso-decir-si-tiene-plata-en-el-exterior|title= Elaskar no quiso decir si tiene plata en el exterior|trans-title=Elaskar did not want to say if he has money abroad|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> Fariña said that he had received $70,000 working for a man close to Báez, in addition to payment for his wife's artwork. He denied transporting bags of money, saying that he visited Uruguay and Mexico as a tourist. But, he acknowledged working for Báez at Austral Construcciones.<ref name="dosdec"/> Since the income detailed by Fariña was insufficient for his lifestyle,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1591140-farina-dejo-muchas-dudas-ante-el-juez|title= Fariña dejó muchas dudas ante el juez|trans-title=Fariña left many doubts before the judge|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= June 12, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> Casanello broadened his investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1616457-caso-baez-allanan-una-firma-y-carrio-pide-interpelar-a-timerman|title= Caso Báez: allanan una firma y Carrió pide interpelar a Timerman|trans-title=Báez case: a firm is investigated, and Carrió asks to inquiry Timerman|language= Spanish|author= |date= September 3, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref>
Carrió provided photos and a witness to the emptying of a vault at Báez's house in Santa Cruz; Casanello gave the witness protection, and proposed to send the case to the judiciary of the Santa Cruz province. Marijuan, however, thought it should be incorporated into the existing case. His appeal was received by the Federal Chamber and upheld by judges Horacio Cattani, Martín Irurzun and Eduardo Farah.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1588277-la-denuncia-de-las-bovedas-sera-investigada-desde-buenos-aires|title= La denuncia de las bóvedas será investigada desde Buenos Aires|trans-title=The denounce of the vaults will be investigated in Buenos Aires|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 4, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Casanello ordered a search of Baez's house, including his safes.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1589227-gendarmeria-nacional-allana-el-galpon-de-lazaro-baez-en-santa-cruz|title= Gendarmería Nacional allana el galpón de Lázaro Báez en Santa Cruz|trans-title=National gendarmerie seizes the house of Lázaro Báez in Santa Cruz|language= Spanish|author= Mariela Arias|date= June 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 14, 2014}}</ref> The investigation, 15 days after the accusation, was fruitless.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1591830-no-encontraron-dinero-en-las-estancias-de-baez|title= No encontraron dinero en las estancias de Báez|trans-title=They did not find money at Báez farm|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= June 14, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> Casanello also ordered a search of the walls, to determine if there had been a vault.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1591725-ordenan-peritar-la-chacra-de-lazaro-baez-para-determinar-si-hubo-una-boveda|title= Ordenan peritar la chacra de Lázaro Báez para determinar si hubo una bóveda|trans-title=It is ordered to investigate the farm of Lázaro Báez to settle if there was a vault|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> The judge closed the cause after concluding that there never existed at Lázaro Báez's farm house the vaults that Lanata's TV report denounced as the storage of money related to its own accusations.<ref name= "Baez vaults">{{cite news |last= |first= |date= 24 August 2014 |title= Los bolsos con dinero que no existieron |trans-title= The bags that didn't existed |url= http://www.lacapital.com.ar/politica/El-juez-Casanello-archivo-la-denuncia-por-la-boveda-en-la-casa-de-Lazaro-Baez--20140825-0086.html |language= spanish |newspaper= La Capital 12 |location= Rosario, Argentina |access-date= 17 February 2016}}</ref>
Báez' lawyers asked Campagnoli to recuse the prosecutor, claiming that his sister was affiliated with the [[Civic Coalition ARI|Civic Coalition]] Carrió led.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1614280-buscan-apartar-al-fiscal-de-la-investigacion|title= Buscan apartar al fiscal de la investigación|trans-title=They seek to remove the prosecutor from the investigation|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 27, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> Carbó accused him of abuse of authority and infringing on other prosecutors' jurisdictions.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1645139-gils-carbo-pidio-la-suspension-del-fiscal-que-investigo-a-lazaro-baez|title= Gils Carbó pidió la suspensión del fiscal que investigó a Lázaro Báez|trans-title=Gils Carbó asked for the suspension of the prosecutor that investigated Lázaro Báez|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= December 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> Campagnoli replied that he was just doing his job,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1645264-el-fiscal-campagnoli-le-respondio-a-gils-carbo-como-van-a-suspender-a-un-fiscal-por-investig|title= El fiscal Campagnoli le respondió a Gils Carbó: "¿Cómo van a suspender a un fiscal por investigar?"|trans-title=Prosecutor Campagnoli replied to Gils Carbó: "How can you suspend a prosecutor for investigating?"|language= Spanish|author= |date= December 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> and was supported by prosecutors' organizations.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1646666-la-asociacion-de-fiscales-respaldo-a-campagnoli|title= La asociación de fiscales respaldó a Campagnoli|trans-title=The association of prosecutors supported Campagnoli|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= December 11, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref>
====Related cases==== There was no immediate [[search and seizure]] as a result of the first program. Although five cases were heard by two judges at that point, any judge could have secured potential evidence without waiting for the combining of the cases.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573447-dos-jueces-dos-fiscales-y-ningun-allanamiento|title= Dos jueces, dos fiscales y ningún allanamiento|trans-title=Two judges, two prosecutors and no search-and-seizure|language= Spanish|author= Adrián Ventura|date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 12, 2013}}</ref> Opposition parties criticized the lack of immediate action, attributing it to government-appointed chief of prosecutors [[Alejandra Gils Carbó]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573798-critican-la-falta-de-reaccion-de-los-fiscales|title= Critican la falta de reacción de los fiscales|trans-title=The lack of reaction of prosecutors is criticized|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 18, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Several neighbours reported on April 17 that documentation was removed from the Madero Center (the alleged location of La Rosadita) over a several-hour period;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573820-habrian-sacado-pruebas-de-la-rosadita|title= Habrían sacado pruebas de "la Rosadita"|trans-title=They would have removed evidence from "La Rosadita"|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 18, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> a search and seizure was conducted the following day.<ref name="farelaros">{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1574159-piden-indagar-a-farina-y-a-elaskar-y-allanan-la-rosadita|title= Piden indagar a Fariña y a Elaskar y allanan "La Rosadita"|trans-title=Fariña and Elaskar are requested for inquiry and "La Rosadita" is intervened|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 19, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Casanello requisitioned security-camera tapes to ascertain if documents were removed before the operation,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1574682-siguio-el-allanamiento-en-el-madero-center|title= Siguió el allanamiento en el Madero Center|trans-title=The search and seizure at Madero Center continued|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 20, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> and the investigation suggested that information may have been erased from computers between the first program and the search-and-seizure operation.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1575403-hubo-nuevos-allanamientos-por-el-caso-baez-y-buscan-mas-financieras|title= Hubo nuevos allanamientos por el caso Báez y buscan más financieras|trans-title=There were new search and seizures for the Baez case, they seek more financial firms|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= April 23, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 30, 2013}}</ref> It was discovered that Austral Construcciones (owned by Lázaro Báez and operating with large sums of money) was a client of La Rosadita<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1581018-una-firma-del-grupo-cambiaba-cheques-en-la-rosadita|title= Una firma del grupo cambiaba cheques en "La Rosadita"|trans-title=A firm of the group exchanged checks at "La Rosadita"|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= May 11, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> and its telephones had Báez on [[speed dial]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1594078-en-la-rosadita-habia-una-linea-directa-con-los-numeros-de-baez|title= En "La Rosadita" había una línea directa con los números de Báez|trans-title=In "La Rosadita" there was a speed dial to Báez's phone numbers|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= June 21, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> The son of Daniel Pérez Gadín (Báez's accountant) was identified in the security tapes as one of the men removing papers, boxes and file folders before the search and seizure;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1593890-un-hijo-de-perez-gadin-movio-cajas-con-papeles|title= Un hijo de Pérez Gadín movió cajas con papeles|trans-title=A son of Pérez Gadín moved boxes with papers|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 20, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> Casanello opened a separate investigation.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1593676-caso-baez-abren-una-causa-paralela-sobre-el-presunto-vaciamiento-de-sgi|title= Caso Báez: abren una causa paralela sobre el presunto vaciamiento de SGI|trans-title=Báez case: they open a second case over the alleged emptying of SGI|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 19, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref>
Still not charged, Báez sued Fariña and Elaskar for defamation<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1577689-replica-de-lazaro-baez-querellara-a-farina-y-a-elaskar|title= Réplica de Lázaro Báez: querellará a Fariña y a Elaskar|trans-title=Counter reaction of Lázaro Báez: he will fill a case against Fariña and Elaskar|language= Spanish|author= Hernán Cappiello|date= April 30, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 2, 2014}}</ref> and subpoenaed [[Jorge Rial]] and [[Luis Ventura]] (hosts of ''Intrusos...'') as witnesses.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1582487-lazaro-baez-denuncia-leonardo-farina-y-quiere-que-declaren-rial-y-ventura|title= Lázaro Báez denuncia a Leonardo Fariña y quiere que declaren Rial y Ventura|trans-title=Lázaro Báez denounces Leonardo Fariña and wants Rial and Ventura to testify|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 16, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Fariña's suit was heard by judge [[Raúl García (judge)|Raúl García]], and Elaskar's by judge [[Fernando Pigni]]. García dismissed the suit.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1597604-la-justicia-rechazo-la-denuncia-de-lazaro-baez-contra-leonardo-farina-por-calumnias|title= La Justicia rechazó la denuncia de Lázaro Báez contra Leonardo Fariña por "calumnias"|trans-title=The judiciary rejected the denounce of Lázaro Báez against Leonardo Fariña for "defamations"|language= Spanish|author= |date= July 2, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref>
Prosecutor [[Guillermo Marijuan]] extended the investigation on May 4 to Lázaro Báez, his son Martín, Báez's accountant Daniel Pérez Gadín and Fabián Rossi. He criticized Gonella for not including them in the original case, and for investigating Fariña and Elaskar only when the case made the news.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1578930-el-fiscal-imputo-a-baez-en-la-causa-por-lavado|title= El fiscal imputó a Báez en la causa por lavado|trans-title=The prosecutor accused Báez in the case of money laundering|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= May 4, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 2, 2014}}</ref> Legislator Julio Raffo, from [[Proyecto Sur]], accused public official Gonella of [[nonfeasance in office]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1579476-denuncian-a-carlos-gonella-por-no-haber-imputado-a-lazaro-baez|title= Denuncian a Carlos Gonella por no haber imputado a Lázaro Báez|trans-title=Carlos Gonella is denounced for not accusing Lázaro Báez|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref>
Elisa Carrió said that Miriam Quiroga's testimony was similar to her 2008 reports during an ongoing corruption case against Néstor Kirchner, Báez, Julio De Vido, Carlos Zannini, Ricardo Jaime, [[Claudio Uberti]] and Rudy Ulloa, and hoped that judge [[Julián Ercollini]] would expedite the case.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1579379-elisa-carrio-llevo-el-testimonio-de-miriam-quiroga-a-la-justicia|title= Elisa Carrió llevó el testimonio de Miriam Quiroga a la Justicia|trans-title=Elisa Carrió took the testimony of Miriam Quiroga to the judiciary|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 6, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Quiroga's testimony was heard by judge [[Julián Ercolini]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1581888-la-ex-secretaria-de-nestor-kirchner-declara-ante-la-justicia|title= La ex secretaria de Néstor Kirchner declaró ante la Justicia|trans-title=The former secretary of Néstor Kirchner gave testimony to the judiciary|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 14, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 6, 2014}}</ref> She testified that Kirchner instructed Rudy Ulloa and [[Cristóbal López (businessman)|Cristobal López]] to buy media and how to manage public works, but did not remember details. Quiroga was not asked about the bags of money she mentioned in Lanata's program because it concerned a different case; that testimony will be heard by judge Luis Rodríguez.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1582094-miriam-quiroga-dijo-que-kirchner-insto-a-ulloa-y-lopez-a-comprar-medios|title= Miriam Quiroga dijo que Kirchner instó a Ulloa y López a comprar medios|trans-title=Miriam Quiroga said that Kirchner instructed Ulloa and López to buy media|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= May 15, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Daniel Muñoz, Kirchner's former secretary, was accused by prosecutor Ramiro González of involvement in the conspiracy.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1584066-imputaron-al-ex-secretario-de-nestor-kirchner-por-los-supuestos-bolsos-con-dinero|title= La Justicia imputó al ex secretario de Néstor Kirchner por los supuestos "bolsos con dinero"|trans-title=The judiciary accused the former secretary of Néstor Kirchner for the alleged "bags with money"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 21, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Pablo Senyszyn, Néstor Kirchner's bodyguard, denied seeing money bags and said that any bags would have been detected by security;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1615536-un-ex-custodio-de-nestor-kirchner-nego-la-entrada-de-bolsos-con-dinero-a-casa-rosada|title= Un ex custodio de Néstor Kirchner negó la entrada de bolsos con dinero a Casa Rosada|trans-title=A former bodyguard of Néstor Kirchner denied the entry of bags of money to Casa Rosada|language= Spanish|author= |date= August 30, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> he was suspended and replaced by Claudia Katok and Cristina Caamaño.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1647756-designan-a-katok-y-caamano-para-reemplazar-al-fiscal-suspendido|title= Designan a Katok y Caamaño para reemplazar al fiscal suspendido|trans-title=Katok and Caamaño are appointed to replace the suspended prosecutor|language= Spanish|author= |date= December 14, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref>
==={{anchor|International}}International response=== The [[Uruguayan Air Force]] and Uruaguayan customs began an informal investigation of the Uruguayan link. Elaskar testified that Fariña sent the bags of money to Uruguayan financial companies, which in turn sent them to Switzerland. The Uruguayans investigated whether the flights were destined to [[Carrasco International Airport|Carrasco]] and whether the dates and crews matched. Deputy [[Juan Manuel Garino]] called for an investigation of a possible security breach at Uruguayan airports.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/chequean-informacion-sobre-las-valijas-con-dinero-de-empresario-k.html|title= Chequean información sobre las valijas con dinero de empresario K|trans-title=They check information about the money suitcases of a K businessman|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 20, 2013|work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Ministers [[Fernando Lorenzo]] and [[Eleuterio Fernández Huidobro]] addressed the Uruguayan Congress, describing controls on money laundering.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1574762-las-denuncias-de-lavado-de-dinero-derivan-a-sesiones-en-parlamento-uruguayo|title= Las denuncias de lavado de dinero derivan a sesiones en Parlamento uruguayo|trans-title=The denounces about money laundering move to sessions of the Uruguayan congress|language= Spanish|author= Nelson Fernández|date= April 20, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> Uruguayan President [[José Mujica]] said that such banking operations would not go unnoticed in his country, but acknowledged that money may have been smuggled;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/mujica-resto-importancia-a-la-denuncia-de-jorge-lanata.html|title= Mujica minimizó la denuncia del periodista argentino Jorge Lanata|trans-title=Mujica dismissed the denounce of Argentine journalist Jorge Lanata|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 23, 2013|work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 30, 2014}}</ref> the minister of defense revealed the existence of more than 900 unregulated airports.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/detectaron-existencia-de-900-pistas.html|title= Detectaron la existencia de 900 pistas de aterrizaje no declaradas|trans-title=They detected the existence of 900 undeclared airports|language= Spanish|author= Gonzalo Terra|date= |work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 30, 2014}}</ref> The Uruguayan case was conducted by judge [[Martín Gesto]] and prosecutor José Gómez, with [[Interpol]] support.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1576155-uruguay-e-interpol-investigan-el-lavado-y-trafico-de-dinero-denunciado-por-lanata|title= Uruguay e Interpol investigan el lavado y tráfico de dinero denunciado por Lanata|trans-title=Uruguay and Interpol investigate the money laundering denounced by Lanata|language= Spanish|author= Nelson Fernández|date= April 25, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 30, 2013}}</ref> Before the Uruguayan Congress, judge [[Néstor Valetti]] criticized a lack of Argentine co-operation.<ref name="reciprocidad">{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/dinerok-falta-reciprocidad-justicia-argentina.html|title= Dinero K: falta de "reciprocidad" de la Justicia argentina, dice juez|trans-title=K money: lack of "reciprocity" or Argentine Judiciary, says a judge|language= Spanish|author= Pablo Meléndrez|date= |work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> Argentine deputy Graciela Ocaña accused the chancellery of blocking communications between the countries.<ref name="reciprocidad" /> As of January 2014, the investigation was stalled.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/argentina-datos-uruguay-freno-causa.html|title= Argentina no dio datos y Uruguay frena la causa K|trans-title=Argentina gave no information and Uruguay halts the K cause|language= Spanish|author= |date= January 29, 2014|work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 27, 2014}}</ref>
The Swiss courts began their own investigation with information from Argentine deputies Garrido and Ocaña;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1577693-suiza-abrio-una-causa-y-pedira-pruebas|title= Suiza abrió una causa y pedirá pruebas|trans-title=Switzerland opened a case and will request proof|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 30, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 2, 2014}}</ref> however, Switzerland required input from the Argentine judiciary to pursue the case.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1578200-suiza-aguarda-mas-informacion-para-investigar-a-lazaro-baez|title= Suiza aguarda más información para investigar a Lázaro Báez|trans-title=Switzerland awaits more information to investigate Lázaro Báez|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 2, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 2, 2014}}</ref> ''[[Le Matin (Switzerland)|Le Matin]]'' and ''[[Tages-Anzeiger]]'' reported the ongoing Argentine controversy, and public opinion opposed illicit money in Swiss banks.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/mundo/la-ruta-del-dinero-k-tambien-inquieta-a-suiza.html|title= La ruta del dinero "K" también inquieta a Suiza|trans-title=The K money trail worries Switzerland as well|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 5, 2013|work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 30, 2014}}</ref> However, the Swiss case is not directly related to the Argentine one.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1610453-la-justicia-de-suiza-confirmo-que-investiga-cuentas-de-baez|title= La justicia de Suiza confirmó que investiga cuentas de Báez|trans-title=The Swiss judiciary confirmed that they investigate Báez's accounts|language= Spanish|author= Martín Dinatale|date= August 14, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 13, 2014}}</ref> Casanello and prosecutor Marijuan were invited to Switzerland to confer with local judges, but their trip was cancelled.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1643057-caso-baez-el-juez-no-viaja-a-suiza|title= Caso Báez: el juez no viaja a Suiza|trans-title=Báez case: the judge will not go to Switzerland|language= Spanish|author= Paz Rodriguez Niell|date= November 29, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref>
Casanello formally requested information about Teegan from the Panamanian courts.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1585168-casanello-pidio-informacion-a-panama-sobre-la-ruta-del-presunto-lavado-de-dinero-de-baez|title= Casanello pidió información a Panamá sobre la ruta del presunto lavado de dinero de Báez|trans-title=Casanello requested information to Panama about Báez money laundering trail|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 24, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Since Báez has at least six companies in [[Florida]], Elisa Carrió informed local prosecutors and American legislator [[Carl Levin]] (a money-laundering expert) about the case.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1591420-carrio-llevo-denuncias-de-lavado-a-eeuu|title= Carrió llevó denuncias de lavado a EE.UU.|trans-title=Carrió took the denounces of money laundering to the United States|language= Spanish|author= Silvia Pisani|date= June 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref>
==Reactions== [[File:PorCampagnoli7.jpg|thumb|Demonstration in support of [[José María Campagnoli]].]] Initially, the government had no comment about the controversy.<ref name="Mercopress" /> Only deputy [[Carlos Kunkel]] said that although he did not know Lázaro Báez, if he committed a crime he had to go to prison; however, he thought there was insufficient evidence.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573225-carlos-kunkel-dijo-que-si-se-prueba-que-lazaro-baez-cometio-un-delito-deberia-ir-preso|title= Carlos Kunkel dijo que si se prueba que Lázaro Báez cometió un delito, debería ir "preso"|trans-title=Carlos Kunkel said that, if it proved that Lázaro Báez committed a crime, he should go to prison|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 16, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 9, 2013}}</ref> Governor of Santa Cruz province [[Daniel Peralta]] denied any connection to Báez, saying that public works in the province were financed by the national government since 2008 through [[Vialidad Nacional]]. Once a Kirchner supporter, Peralta had turned to [[Federal Peronism]]. He said that the national government had invested [[Argentine peso|$]]770 million in public works from 2007 to 2012, and that control of such finances was the purview of the [[Sindicatura General de la Nación|SIGEN]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573461-el-cruce-de-denuncias-hace-crecer-el-scandalo-en-santa-cruz|title= En Santa Cruz el escándalo crece por el cruce de denuncias|trans-title=The scandal grows in Santa Cruz because of the crossed denounces|language= Spanish|author= Mariela Arias|date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 13, 2013}}</ref> Minister [[Julio de Vido]] considered the scandal an attempt to halt construction of the dams [[Néstor Kirchner Dam|Néstor Kirchner]] and [[Jorge Cepernic Dam]]s.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573556-julio-de-vido-jorge-lanata-leonardo-farina|title= De Vido habla de una "operación mediática para parar" la construcción de dos represas|trans-title=De Vido talks about a "media operation" to halt the construction of two dams|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 24, 2013}}</ref> Báez, in a [[news conference]] where he took no questions, considered it an attempt to defame Néstor Kirchner; he questioned Fariña and Elaskar's reliability and the authenticity of the documents shown on the program.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1574432-lazaro-baez-me-quisieron-usar-como-forro-de-un-amigo-que-era-nestor-kirchner|title= Lázaro Báez: "Me quieren utilizar de forro para manchar la imagen de mi amigo Néstor"|trans-title=Lázaro Báez: "They want to use me as a condom to stain the image of my friend Néstor"|language= Spanish|author= Mariela Arias|date= April 19, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref>
Since Leonardo Fariña was the husband of television personality [[Karina Jelinek]], the government tried to treat the program's revelations as a dispute between TV presenters on its controlled TV channels to discredit it.<ref name="Mendelevich158" /> It hoped focusing Fariña would deflect attention from Kirchner.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1573167-eing l-gobierno-buscara-farandulizar-el-caso|title= El gobierno buscará farandulizar el caso|trans-title=The government will attempt to trivialize the case|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 16, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=November 11, 2013}}</ref> This attempt failed, and the extended coverage increased awareness of the controversy among the apolitical population. Details of the money's being weighed (instead of counted) and politicians' home vaults increased lay understanding of the corruption controversy's scope.<ref name="Mendelevich158">Mendelevich, p. 158</ref>
Public interest in the controversy resembled that in a [[telenovela]]; a large portion of the population awaited each new airing of ''Periodismo para todos'', and its revelations were discussed during the week. A survey concerning the controversy found that 80% of the respondents followed it, 70% thought the accusations were true and 65% thought it affected the president's public image. Two-thirds of the respondents agreed that the level of corruption during the Kirchner presidencies was similar (or higher) than that during the presidency of [[Carlos Menem]]. Public reception of the controversy may have been influenced by the ongoing [[Argentine economic crisis]], the suspicion of presidential involvement and Lanata's persuasiveness.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1580958-el-caso-baez-un-escandalo-de-repercusion-inedita|title= El caso Báez, un escándalo de repercusión inédita|trans-title=The Baez case, a scandal of unprecedented repercution|language= Spanish|author= Eduardo Fidanza|date= May 11, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref>
National deputy [[Andrés Larroque]] considered the scandal a veiled coup attempt by the media.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1584997-el-jefe-de-la-campora-vuelve-a-denunciar-un-movimiento-destituyente-y-convoca-a-organizarse|title= El jefe de La Cámpora vuelve a denunciar "un movimiento destituyente" y convoca a "organizarse"|trans-title=The chief of La Cámpora denounces again "a destituent movement" and calls for "organization"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 24, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 22, 2013}}</ref> Writer [[Ricardo Forster]] minimized the significance of political corruption, considering interest in it by the media a threat to democracy.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1584744-ricardo-forster-que-carajo-se-como-hizo-la-plata-lazaro-baez|title= Ricardo Forster: "¡Qué carajo sé cómo hizo la plata Lázaro Báez!"|trans-title=Ricardo Foster: "How the hell would I know how did Lázaro Báez made his money!"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 23, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=October 22, 2013}}</ref> Presidential secretary [[Oscar Parrilli]] accused media groups of attempting to generate [[terrorism]] against the Kirchner presidencies.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1581660-oscar-parrilli-hay-alcahuetes-mediaticos-que-crean-un-clima-de-terror|title= Oscar Parrilli: "Hay alcahuetes mediáticos que crean un clima de terror"|trans-title=Oscar Parrilli: "There are media pimps who create a climate of terror"|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Presidential undersecretary Gustavo López said that the scandal was caused by [[corporate group]] warfare against the government.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1581520-la-reaccion-kirchnerista-tras-el-programa-de-jorge-lanata|title= La reacción kirchnerista tras el programa de Jorge Lanata|trans-title=The kirchnerist reaction after the program of Jorge Lanata|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 13, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> Alleged threats to democracy and allegations of coup attempts are a common element of [[Kirchnerism|Kirchnerite]] criticism of political opposition since the [[2008 Argentine government conflict with the agricultural sector]].<ref>Mendelevich, p. 106-108</ref>
The government tried to shrink the audience for ''Periodismo para todos'' by rescheduling the most-important soccer match of the week against it. The tactic was unsuccessful; Lanata received 24.7 rating points, compared with 16 for the Boca-[[Newell's Old Boys]] match.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.elpais.com.uy/mundo/mundo-lanata-gobierno-quiere-rating.html|title= Que Mujica "se ponga de acuerdo" con su ministro sobre si hay lavado|trans-title=Let Mujica "come to an agreement" with his minister about the presence of embelezzment|language= Spanish|author= |date= May 27, 2013|work= |publisher= El País|accessdate=March 30, 2014}}</ref> Journalist Jorge Fernández Díaz said that soccer matches had not been scheduled so late the previous year, when ''Periodismo para todos'' had an average of 15 ratings points instead of 25.<ref name="futbol" /> The June 16 match between [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] and [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]] violated an [[Argentine Football Association]] rule requiring the last two matches of teams with chances to win a tournament to be played concurrently.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1592823-por-cuarta-semana-consecutiva-jorge-lanata-le-gano-al-futbol|title= Por cuarta semana consecutiva, Jorge Lanata le ganó al fútbol|trans-title=For the fourth consecutive week, Jorge Lanata prevailed over soccer|language= Spanish|author= |date= June 17, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref>
Although Lázaro Báez intended to run for governor of Santa Cruz province in 2015, as of April 2013 he engaged in no political activity in the [[Justicialist Party]] or the [[Front for Victory]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1574901-una-candidatura-que-ahora-quedo-congelada|title= Una candidatura que ahora quedó congelada|trans-title=A candidacy that got frozen|language= Spanish|author= |date= April 21, 2013|work= |publisher= La Nación|accessdate=December 25, 2013}}</ref> The "Route of the K-Money" episode of ''Periodismo para todos'' won a silver medal for Best Investigative Report in the 2014 New York Festivals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorkfestivals.com/winners/2014/pieces.php?iid=466089&pid=1|title=Piece #1 - Periodismo para todos (Journalism for All) : La Ruta del Dinero K (The Route of the K-Money)|publisher=International Awards Group LLC|accessdate=April 16, 2014}}</ref>
==Bibliography== * {{cite book |last= Mendelevich|first= Pablo|authorlink= |title= El relato kirchnerista en 200 expresiones|url= |accessdate= |year= 2013|publisher= Ediciones B|location= |isbn= 978-987-627-412-8|page=}}
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== {{Commons category}} * [http://www.newyorkfestivals.com/winners/2014/pieces.php?iid=466089&pid=1 Journalism for All : The Route of the K-Money] on the New York Festivals website (with [[subtitle (captioning)|subtitle]]s) * [http://www.eltrecetv.com.ar/periodismo-para-todos/el-documental-de-la-ruta-del-dinero-k_065778 ''Periodismo para todos'': El documental de la ruta del dinero K] {{es}}, summary of the case * [http://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2013/05/06/denuncia-de-corrupcion-salpica-al-gobierno-de-los-kirchner-en-argentina/ Report by CNN en Español] {{es}} * [http://www.bubblear.com/lazaro-baez-case-explained/ What Is The Lázaro Báez Case And Why Is It So Significant?] The Bubble (Apr 7, 2016)
{{CFK}}

revision.text:
{{about|the urban legend|the injury caused by spiders|Spider bite}} [[File:Aranhas. ninho. Vilarromaris. Galiza.jpg|thumb|right|Newly hatched ''[[Araneus diadematus]]'']] '''The Spider Bite''' or '''The Red Spot''' is a modern [[urban legend]] that emerged in Europe during the 1970s.
==Plot== The legend features a young woman from an ordinary, northern location ([[England]], [[New York City]], etc.), who is on vacation abroad in an exotic, southern location ([[Mexico]], [[South America]], etc.). While sunbathing on the beach, she is bitten on the cheek by a spider. The bite swells into a large boil and she rushes home to seek medical treatment. She finds a doctor to lance the boil then hundreds of tiny spiders come running out of her cheek. She then goes insane from the shock.
==Variations== In other versions, a young girl is asleep while a spider crawls across her face and rests on her cheek for a few moments. The next morning, she asks her mother about the red spot on her cheek and the mother responds, "It looks like a spider bite. It will go away, just don't scratch it." As time passes, the spot grows into a small boil. She confronts her mother again and complains that it is getting larger and that it's sore. The mother replies, "That happens sometimes, it's coming to a head." More days pass and the girl complains that it hurts and is unsightly. Finally concerned that it might be infected, the mother agrees to take her to a doctor, but he is not available until the next day. In order to soothe herself that evening, the girl takes a bath. As she soaks, the boil bursts and releases a swarm of baby spiders into the water from the eggs that the mother had laid.<ref>Schwartz; p. 62</ref>
In telling the story, there are versions that are set in one's own country instead of being abroad (''e.g.,'' a Midwestern woman who is bitten in [[California]]). Usually, when the story is told to others, the location of the incident is quite specific.
==History== The legend of ''The Spider Bite'' emerged as a modern legend in Europe in the late 1970s, but it echoes earlier manifestations of the bosom-serpent story type, where all types of creatures enter the body and sometimes reproduce there.<ref>Brunvand; p. 408</ref> Modern folklorists adopted the term bosom-serpent from [[Nathaniel Hawthorne|Nathaniel Hawthorne's]] 1843 short story, [[Egotism; or, The Bosom-Serpent|''Egotism, or, the Bosom Serpent'']]. The term is now used to generalize other legends in which living creatures enter the human body. In bosom-serpent type legends, the creatures usually have to be removed surgically, but sometimes they depart on their own, or even burst from the skin.<ref>Brunvand; p. 42</ref>
==Interpretations== This urban legend provides a social commentary about the perception of the people who consider southern locales to be less clean, and more dangerous than their own home turf. Spiders are loathed by many people, but venomous, hairy, or especially large spiders make frequent appearances in legends.<ref>Brunvand; p. 409</ref> Spiders in urban legends have often taken cover in a variety of items ranging from cactus plants and food, to hairdos and within the human body, so it is natural to have a fear of invasion. [[Bengt af Klintberg]]'s work in urban legends elaborates and explains that as a consequence of the absence of spiders in the modern urban environment, they have now assumed mythical proportions in our narrative tradition.<ref>Af Klintberg; pp. 274—287</ref> Analysts have also suggested that bosom-serpent legends may represent pregnancy fears or fantasies.<ref>Brunvand; p. 43</ref>

{{Drugbox | Verifiedfields = changed | Watchedfields = changed | verifiedrevid = 470635867 | IUPAC_name = (''Z'')-3-(4-Bromophenyl)-''N'',''N''-dimethyl-3-(pyridin-3-yl)prop-2-en-1-amine | image = Zimelidine.svg | width = 222 | tradename = | pregnancy_category = | legal_status = Withdrawn worldwide | routes_of_administration = Oral | bioavailability = | metabolism = | elimination_half-life = 8.4±2 hours (parent compound)
19.4±3.6 hours (norzimelidine){{cite journal |vauthors=Caille G, Kouassi E, de Montigny C | title=Pharmacokinetic study of zimelidine using a new GLC method| journal=Clinical Pharmacokinetics| volume=8| issue=6| year=1986| pages=530–40 | pmid=6228368 | doi=10.2165/00003088-198308060-00004}} | excretion = | CAS_number_Ref = {{cascite|changed|??}} | CAS_number = 56775-88-3 | CAS_supplemental = 60525-15-7 (anhydrous dihydrochloride), 61129-30-4 (dihydrochloride monohydrate) | ATC_prefix = N06 | ATC_suffix = AB02 | PubChem = 5365247[https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/summary/summary.cgi?sid=46504589&viewopt=PubChem Pubchem record] | DrugBank_Ref = {{drugbankcite|correct|drugbank}} | DrugBank = DB04832 | ChemSpiderID_Ref = {{chemspidercite|correct|chemspider}} | ChemSpiderID = 4517305 | UNII_Ref = {{fdacite|correct|FDA}} | UNII = 3J928617DW | ChEMBL_Ref = {{ebicite|correct|EBI}} | ChEMBL = 37744 | C=16 | H=17 | Br=1 | N=2 | molecular_weight = 317.224 g/mol | smiles = Brc2ccc(C(=C/CN(C)C)/c1cccnc1)cc2 | StdInChI_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChI = 1S/C16H17BrN2/c1-19(2)11-9-16(14-4-3-10-18-12-14)13-5-7-15(17)8-6-13/h3-10,12H,11H2,1-2H3/b16-9- | StdInChIKey_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChIKey = OYPPVKRFBIWMSX-SXGWCWSVSA-N }} '''Zimelidine''' ([[International Nonproprietary Name|INN]], [[British Approved Name|BAN]]) (brand names '''Zimeldine''', '''Normud''', '''Zelmid''') was one of the first [[selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor]] (SSRI) [[antidepressant]]s to be marketed. It is a pyridylallylamine, and is structurally different from other antidepressants.{{cite book | author = Barondes, Samuel H. | title = Better Than Prozac | pages = 39–40}} Zimelidine was developed in the late 1970s and early 1980s by [[Arvid Carlsson]], who was then working for the [[Sweden|Swedish]] company [[AstraZeneca|Astra AB]]. It was discovered following a search for drugs with structures similar to [[brompheniramine]] (it is a [[derivative (chemistry)|derivative]] of brompheniramine), an [[antihistamine]] with antidepressant activity. Zimelidine was first sold in 1982.{{cite journal | pmc=1028185| year=1985| author1=Fagius| first1=J| title=Guillain–Barré syndrome following zimeldine treatment| journal=Journal of Neurology, Neurosurgery, and Psychiatry| volume=48| issue=1| pages=65–69| last2=Osterman| first2=P. O.| last3=Sidén| first3=A| last4=Wiholm| first4=B. E.| doi=10.1136/jnnp.48.1.65| pmid=3156214}} While zilmelidine had a very favorable safety profile, within a year and a half of its introduction, rare case reports of [[Guillain–Barré syndrome]] emerged that appeared to be caused by the drug, prompting its manufacturer to withdraw it from the market.{{cite journal | pmid=11691978| year=2001| author1=Carlsson| first1=A| title=A paradigm shift in brain research| journal=Science| volume=294| issue=5544| pages=1021–4| doi=10.1126/science.1066969| bibcode=2001Sci...294.1021C}} After its withdrawal, it was succeeded by [[fluvoxamine]] and [[fluoxetine]] (derived from the antihistamine [[diphenhydramine]]) in that order, and the other SSRIs. ==Mechanism of action== The mode of action is a strong reuptake inhibition of [[serotonin]] from the synaptic cleft. Postsynaptic receptors are not acted upon. ==Other uses== Zimelidine was reported by Montplaisir and Godbout to be very effective for [[cataplexy]] in 1986, back when this was usually controlled by [[tricyclic antidepressant]]s, which often had [[anticholinergic]] effects.{{cite journal | author=Godbout R, Montplaisir J.| title=The effect of zimelidine, a serotonin-reuptake blocker, on cataplexy and daytime sleepiness of narcoleptic patients| journal=Clinical Neuropharmacology| volume=9| issue=1| year=1986| pages=46–51 | pmid=2950994| doi=10.1097/00002826-198602000-00004| last2=Montplaisir}} Zimelidine was able to improve cataplexy without causing daytime sleepiness. ==Side effects== Most often reported were: * Dry mouth, dryness of [[pharynx|pharyngeal]] and nasal membranes * Increased sweating ([[hyperhidrosis]]) * [[Vertigo (medical)|Vertigo]] * [[Nausea]] ==Interactions== * [[MAOIs|MAO inhibitor]]s — severe or life-threatening reactions possible{{medcn|date=March 2016}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Antidepressants}} {{Monoamine reuptake inhibitors}} {{Bromine compounds}} [[Category:Alkene derivatives]] [[Category:Amines]] [[Category:Antidepressants]] [[Category:Hepatotoxins]] [[Category:Organobromides]] [[Category:Pyridines]] [[Category:Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors]] [[Category:Withdrawn drugs]]
